Guiding principle: ""Midpoint"" of the hiring salary range means the individual possesses full job knowledge, qualifications and experience.

We have some flexibility regarding full-time vs. part-time and are looking for candidates who are interested in 0.5 to 1.0 FTE (full-time equivalent). We are also flexible regarding the work location being based mainly in Vancouver or Victoria.
Job Summary

The UBC Department of Family Practice (DFP) has established the primary care Innovation Support Unit (ISU) to connect, engage, and partner with those who are actively involved in innovations in primary care. The ISU is initially focused on supporting innovations in community-situated, team-based care (TBC) in BC, which includes initiatives in primary care transformation such as the Patient's Medical Home (PMH) and Primary Care Networks (PCNs) as these are key provincial strategic elements in achieving a sustainable and high-quality community and primary care system in BC. We are working with collaborators at UBC, the Ministry of Health, BC primary care communities, and several other groups.

The ISU has a number of independent, strategic workstreams related to specific aspects of TBC transformation in Primary Care. Workstreams are a collection of applied, mixed-method action-oriented research projects clustering around a particular pressing issue or need in primary care in BC. Workstreams may focus different areas such as design, testing and deployment of new methods to support change, development of team-based care evaluation framework, or development of EMR based evaluation methods for team-based care.
The Research Analysts will work with Workstream leads and ISU faculty, to perform a range of data collection, analysis, facilitation, and report drafting activities as required.

The ISU has been established as a small but nimble and highly networked team, working with many stakeholders. We are currently expanding, looking to hire 3 more analysts to the team to support the workstreams. Some of the planned work will require more familiarity with quantitative analysis. As a member of a Teal organizational structure, ISU Research Analysts are responsible for engaging across workstream as required and as fits the skills of each of the team members. In this way, the ISU seeks to match team members to projects / workstreams that build on their strengths and skills. The ISU has opportunities for people with a range of skills and experience to broaden the team's views as we tackle the complex challenges in primary care and so we are looking for a broad range of experiences to complement other members of the team.

We are seeking analysts with a desire to engage with skills or experience in primary care or applicable quantitative, qualitative, and action research methods as well as knowledge translation, multimedia, and/or design methods.
Organizational Status

The Department of Family Practice supports researchers and faculty throughout the province. The ISU is a core unit of the department whose goal is to bring an applied academic lens to the changes that are actively occurring in primary care across the province. The ISU's initial focus has been on team-based care. The ISU collaborates with the Ministry of Health, Health Authorities, Divisions of Family Practice, communities, and other provincial organizations to develop and link evidence to change initiatives. The ISU seeks to inform new models of care, test assumptions and gather data to inform system changes.
Work Performed
Specifically, the work will include:
1). Support ISU workstreams by completing specific work, such as:
a. Work with ISU team members on planning of workstreams.
b. Engage in rapid review of evidence, partner documents and compile draft reports
c. Develop Workstream proposals
d. Review and synthesis of quantitative data to inform the development of tools
e. Leading analysis of findings
f. Work with leads to develop draft models for describing service needs and service capacity in primary care
g. Draft findings and reports
h. Develop health data analysis (e.g. EMR queries) to support quality improvement and / or evaluation of team based care
i. Prepare ethics review submissions
2). Spread ISU developed tools and methods
a. Prepare Facilitator Training Sessions and other KT events
b. Engage in facilitator training through in person and virtual platforms as co-facilitator
c. Collate feedback and assist in the revision of the tools and methods
3). Develop resources and tools to support Knowledge Mobilization
a. Prepare drafts of academic articles

b. Develop drafts of other knowledge dissemination products, including outlines / scripts for videos, podcasts, or webinars (this could include participating in the production of such multimedia knowledge products)
4). Work with ISU team
a. Engage in ISU team activities (meetings, design fests, etc.)
b. Contribute to the internal work of the ISU as a team (take on internal team roles, provide feedback on new ideas, etc.)
c. Prepare, edit, and proof grant applications, contracts, and scientific communications
The successful candidates will play a role within the ISU that matches their strengths and the needs of our partner projects. Thus, the candidate may focus more or less on one of the above aspects.
Supervision Received

The ISU manager will provide direct supervision. The analyst will work with considerable latitude with research work reviewed against achievement of project objectives. The successful candidate will report to the ISU leadership within the Department of Family Practice.
Supervision Given
May be asked to provide supervision to students in collaboration with ISU Coordinators and ISU Manager.
Consequence of Error/Judgement

The Research Analyst will be dealing with data that is sensitive in nature and confidential and as such will be required to exercise discretion. The Research Analyst will make professional decisions and recommendations on all aspects of the research work and be responsible for the quality of research activities. The Research Analyst will be a representative of the Dept. of Family Practice and ISU and thus will be required to demonstrate a high degree of expertise and professionalism.
Qualifications

Undergraduate degree in a relevant discipline. A BSc in a related field (e.g. Health Information Science, Life Sciences, Public Health) or, ideally, an MSc would be preferred. Minimum of three years experience or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience in evaluation methods - qualitative or quantitative - and group facilitation (of focus groups and/or other community engagement strategies) is also desired. Experience in working with quantitative data, and a background in health informatics, specifically EMRs, is an asset, as is experience in media production for knowledge mobilization, or design thinking in health care.

Work in primary care or overlapping areas, or clinical experience in primary care, an asset. Experience with data analysis (e.g. health data analysis) an asset. The successful candidate will be an enthusiastic and resourceful team member, with excellent interpersonal and communication skills (written and oral) in order to interact effectively with colleagues, clinicians, and stakeholders. The ISU will be working virtually for at least the next 4 months and is a distributed team. There is a possibility that, in the future, travel will be required when working with partner projects (expected to be overnight trips, up to 2-4 times / month).

Equity and diversity are essential to academic excellence. An open and diverse community fosters the inclusion of voices that have been underrepresented or discouraged. We encourage applications from members of groups that have been marginalized on any grounds enumerated under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.
All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply

Researcher / Data Analyst,"Halifax, NS",GeoSpectrum Technologies,,"GeoSpectrum Technologies Inc., (GTI) specializes in underwater acoustic transducers and systems and has been recognized as a leading provider of specialized surveillance software for a variety of applications including military sonar (multistatic-active, passive, mine hunting), marine mammal monitoring, and ocean observation. GTI’s ability to provide integrated, end-to-end sonar systems and winch and handling systems sets us apart from the rest.

We are currently seeking a highly motivated Researcher/Data Analyst who would like to join our Software Team. This position entails designing experiments and simulations, real-world sea trials, data analysis, and algorithm development. Our vision includes the continued development of knowledge and algorithms as part of advancing our core sonar platform used in many product families from small, embedded, underwater sensors to high-volume server applications.
WHAT WE DO
Analyze underwater acoustic data with various degrees of complexity, ranging from simple system tests to full-scale sea trials.
Use, maintain, and advance core software libraries for acoustic signal processing and data analysis.
Work with GTI’s software developers to advance prototype code for implementation in end-user systems.
Design and execute sea trials, using acoustic data simulations and trial planning software to aid in decision making.
Combine planning, execution, processing, and analysis expertise to produce publication-quality data sets and results.
WHAT YOU DO
Use existing software tools and applications to perform acoustic signal processing and analysis.
Research, prototype, and test novel signal processing algorithms and analysis methodology.
Configure and execute acoustic data simulations, and analyze the output data.
Share analysis results with project stakeholders through written and oral communication.
Track progress using Jira ticket tracking software.
QUALIFICATIONS
Must have 0-3 years experience in scientific data analysis and/or programming
A degree from a recognized university’s science or related engineering program
Strong physics, math and problem-solving skills
Experience in software programming (IDL LabVIEW, Matlab, Octave)
Experience using programming languages such as C, C++ and Java
Knowledge/experience in acoustics, signal processing and oceanography is an asset.
Ability to work as part of a team or independently
Motivated and self-starting with a passion for technology

GTI offers a competitive salary and benefits, and a comfortable, flexible work environment within a highly skilled team. If you enjoy tasks that require a methodical approach, attention to detail, and critical analysis

We are looking for an experienced Business Analyst who will be responsible for bridging the gap between operational systems and technology and the business using data analytics to assess processes, determine requirements and deliver data-driven recommendations and reports to executives and stakeholders. Reporting to the Head of IT and DevOps, you will be a member of our cross-functional team. You will engage with business leaders and users to understand how data-driven changes to the process, products, services, software, and hardware will improve efficiencies and add value. You will be able to clearly articulate those ideas and balance them against what is technologically feasible and financially and functionally reasonable.

Your main tasks will include performing detailed requirements analysis, configuring specifications and documenting processes. To excel in this role you should have a natural analytical way of thinking and be able to explain difficult concepts to non-technical team members as well as being able to recommend areas where workflows can be improved.
Key Responsibilities:
Technical
Evaluate business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions

Own and develop relationships with business partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our integration

Communication & personal traits
Explain difficult concepts to non-technical team members
Document and communicate the results of your findings
Report on common sources of technical issues or questions and make recommendations to the team
Mentor and guide junior team members involved with the projects

Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing
Experience in analyzing data to draw business-relevant conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
Demonstrated experience in stakeholder analysis, requirements engineering and cost-benefit analysis
Strong analytical and conceptual thinking skills

About Hear Québec

Hear Québec is the only registered nonprofit organization in Québec which serves Anglophones affected by hearing loss. Hear Québec has been providing ongoing programs, services and support to the hard of hearing community in and around the greater Montreal area since 1979, 40 years. Many of our team and board members are people affected by hearing loss. We understand and are concerned with the struggles and the difficulties that people with hearing difficulties often experience in their daily lives.

Hear Québec’s mandate is not only to offer ongoing programs and services but also to connect and inspire those affected by hearing loss, thereby helping to improve the quality of life and counter isolation. Hear Québec’s various programs help to raise awareness about the potential consequences of hearing loss, such as isolation, depression, anger, and dementia, to name a few. As a largely “invisible” disability, there are many “myths” and misconceptions about hearing loss. Our vision is a community where we can hear, be heard and thrive.

Data analysts will organize and make sense of collections of information in order to make a functional database. They will maintain existing data in order for the organization to make logistical steps forward. Updating and developing a database of service providers i.e. Ear, Nose and Throat Doctors (ENTs), Audiologists etc, to add to the current repertoire. This collection of resource and services providers does not currently exist for the official language minority English community living in Quebec that needs to access these services in their local communities. The candidate will reach out and engage local business, hearing health professional and community partners.

All of this information will be digitized and incorporated into our website, contact relation management systems (CRM )and made accessible through multiple media platforms. Job ID:
Location:
Vancouver - Hospital Site
Employment Group:
Management&Professional (AAPS)
Job Category:
Statistical Analysis
Classification Title:
Statistical Analysis, Level A
Business Title:
Statistical Analyst
VP/Faculty:
Faculty of Medicine
Department:
Emergency Medicine
Salary Range:
Full/Part Time:
Full-Time
Desired Start Date:
Job End Date:
Possibility of Extension:
Yes
Funding Type:
Grant Funded
Closing Date:
Available Openings:
Guiding principle: ""Midpoint"" of the hiring salary range means the individual possesses full job knowledge, qualifications and experience.
Job Summary

The Statistical Analyst will provide analytic and reporting expertise to the Principal Investigator and other members of the research team. This involves accessing data provided by partner organizations, creating datasets for the purposes of analyses, planning analysis, conducting the analyses, and reporting the results.
Organizational Status

The vision of the UBC Department of Emergency Medicine is to be a provincially integrated Department committed to clinical and academic leadership in the creation and exchange of knowledge to promote excellence in emergency care. Our faculty members across the province have had an impressive record of research and discovery. Our research and innovation initiatives include 14 successful programs related to prevention of emergencies, improving clinical care, and system improvements. Road Safety Research is one of the key strategic initiatives of the UBC Department of Emergency Medicine.

The road safety research team is also affiliated with the Vancouver General Hospital (VGH) Emergency Medicine (EM) Research Program which is part of the Vancouver Coastal Health Research Institute. The VGH Emergency Department (ED) treats 90,000 of the most complex and critically ill patients in the province annually. VGH Emergency Department includes over 50 physicians with Royal College specialist certification in emergency medicine, 200 nurses and numerous ancillary staff. The VGH EM Research Program conducts numerous internal and external projects that are recruiting participants from the VGH ED. We have a research office located centrally in the ED, a Research Director and a research advisory committee.

The road safety research team focuses on drug impaired driving, traffic policy evaluation, outcome after road trauma, and active transportation. Most of the analyst's work will pertain to road safety research, specifically data analysis for a large inception cohort study of outcome after road trauma. This project investigates health related quality of life following road trauma, recovery trajectory, and risk factors for a poor recovery. A similar project focusing on active transport (cyclist and pedestrian injuries) of recovery is planned. Although the focus will be on road safety, the analyst may, with the Research Director's approval, provide statistical consultation for other VGH EM Research Program investigators and/or EM residents.

The Statistical Analyst reports to the Principal Investigator, Dr Jeff Brubacher. The incumbent will work collaboratively with other team members to manage and analyze data. The analyst will interact with other research team members and with external collaborators including policy makers, data custodians, and other road safety stakeholders as well as medical students, residents and healthcare professionals both within and outside the Department of Emergency Medicine.
Work Performed

Collaborates with other researchers and statisticians in the identification and completion of assigned research projects. The incumbent will write statistical reports, present the results in scheduled meetings and participate in writing scientific journal papers.
Manages complex large datasets using a variety of software and languages to explore data validity, develop research variables and conduct statistical analysis.
Works with multiple study designs.
Plans, performs and interprets statistical data analysis.
Identifies problems with data and suggests options to the PIs and data manager.
Ensures that all required confidentiality, privacy and data security processes are followed.
Works with PI and research team to develop and write the analysis plan and methods sections for grant applications and for research manuscripts and scientific journals.
Prepares written reports to summarize results for quick dissemination to stakeholders and funders.
Mentors students and residents, delegates work to the team members.
Presents posters at conferences, writes academic manuscripts and technical reports.
Performs other duties as required.
Supervision Received

The incumbent works independently on a day-to-day basis. The incumbent receives overall direction from the Principal Investigator. The incumbent meets with the Principal Investigator and research team on a weekly basis and more often as required.
Supervision Given
The incumbent will provide guidance on analytic issues to other investigators, residents and students as requested by the Principal Investigator.
Consequence of Error/Judgement

Our projects are under tight timelines. The impact of incorrect decisions and errors in judgment would delay productivity and/or loss of data integrity. In the most extreme scenario, the delay in reporting of results to funders would result in loss of operating funds. Inappropriate handling of confidential and sensitive data would result in the loss of privilege in conducting research with the administrative data and could harm future collaboration with data custodians. The incumbent is expected to alert the PIs to any unusual situations, which may affect the project, and to keep the PIs advised of problems that have arisen or that can be anticipated.
Qualifications

Post-graduate degree in Statistics. Minimum of two years experience in research analysis or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Previous experience working with large databases is required. Previous experience with statistical modeling including generalized linear mixed models, ARIMA, techniques for accommodating spatial and temporal correlation, and GIS mapping are required. Familiarity with British Columbia police crash data (the Traffic Accident System), ICBC claims data, and British Columbia Ambulance Service data is required. Sound knowledge in computation and statistics are essential, including efficient coding to process large volumes of data. Demonstrated knowledge of appropriate statistical methods for various study designs, such as interrupted time series, case-crossover, and matched cohort studies. Effective oral and written communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills. Ability to exercise appropriate tact, discretion and confidentiality in all matters. Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines. Ability to work effectively both independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Ability to work a flexible schedule and additional hours occasionally on weekends may be required.

Equity and diversity are essential to academic excellence. An open and diverse community fosters the inclusion of voices that have been underrepresented or discouraged. We encourage applications from members of groups that have been marginalized on any grounds enumerated under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.
All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply

About the Company:

FLEETCOR Technologies, Inc. (NYSE: FLT) is a global leader in business payments. We simplify the way businesses manage and pay their expenses. Our portfolio of brands help companies automate, secure, digitize and control payments to, or on behalf of, their suppliers and employees. Our payment solutions cover four primary expense categories: Payables, Tolls, Fuel, and Lodging. We serve businesses, merchants and partners in North America, Latin America, Europe and Asia Pacific. WHO WE ARE

Mercer is a global force of over 23,000 unique individuals with a passion for enhancing the health, wealth, and careers of 115 million people worldwide. Mercer’s team of passionate experts are uniquely qualified to help organizations of all sizes and industries design and execute sophisticated workforce strategies. We provide best-in-class consulting, rigorous analytics, and data-driven insights to help organizations make fact-based decisions. We are united by a single idea – to make lives better tomorrow through the actions we take today.
THE POSITION: CONSULTING ANALYST

Mercer's Career Consultants work with clients around the world to engage their most important assets – their people. We help clients address critical questions and issues in a changing business world related to:
Their talent: How to design and implement workforce strategies to position their organization for success today and into the future,
Their executives: How to align executive programs to business objectives to enhance company performance and achieve shareholder objectives, and
Their transformation: How to define and navigate the journey of constant change needed to stay competitive.

The first step in your career with Mercer’s Career business is as a Consulting Analyst. Consulting Analysts work with a broad range of clients and industries, participating as a member of project teams to diagnose issues and design strategic solutions. Mercer brings a diverse range of integrated solutions including: Executive and Workforce Rewards, HR Transformation and Digital Implementation, Workforce Strategy & Analytics, Change Management and Communications, and Employee Voice & Engagement. To learn more about Mercer’s Career practice, visit mercer.com/what-we-do/workforce-and-careers.html.

Provide quantitative and qualitative analytical support to senior consultants and project teams

Conduct research and perform financial analyses of industry sectors and client peer groups to understand business strategy, corporate performance, compensation and rewards practices and trends
Design and implement executive, workforce, and sales compensation structures and incentive plans to align pay and performance with corporate strategic objectives
Develop and implement job evaluation systems, performance management programs, and pay equity strategy
Collaborate with project teams on the most effective ways to structure analyses and present information in a meaningful way to meet client objectives
WHAT’S IN IT FOR ME?
Be challenged to deliver impactful solutions for major organizations and have a direct impact on their employees
Varied and meaningful work where you play a critical role from day one
Fine tune your natural skills and learn new ones
Opportunity to work with leading experts in the industry
Excellent growth, mobility and advancement opportunities across Canada and internationally
Supportive and inclusive culture that embraces teamwork, collegiality, and cooperation
WHAT WE VALUE
Strong analytical skills (both quantitative and qualitative), excellent Excel capabilities, and working knowledge of other Microsoft Office applications (Word and PowerPoint)
Knowledge of data analysis, project management, and presentation design
Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills
Intellectual curiosity

Mercer’s roots are in Canada – founded 75 years ago and continues to be one of the elite Canadian business and employment brands. Full-Time

Yes

Guiding principle: ""Midpoint"" of the hiring salary range means the individual possesses full job knowledge, qualifications and experience.
Job Summary

The Statistical Analyst will provide analytic and reporting expertise to the Principal Investigator and other members of the research team. This involves accessing data provided by partner organizations, creating datasets for the purposes of analyses, planning analysis, conducting the analyses, and reporting the results.
Organizational Status

The vision of the UBC Department of Emergency Medicine is to be a provincially integrated Department committed to clinical and academic leadership in the creation and exchange of knowledge to promote excellence in emergency care. Our faculty members across the province have had an impressive record of research and discovery. Our research and innovation initiatives include 14 successful programs related to prevention of emergencies, improving clinical care, and system improvements. Road Safety Research is one of the key strategic initiatives of the UBC Department of Emergency Medicine.

The road safety research team is also affiliated with the Vancouver General Hospital (VGH) Emergency Medicine (EM) Research Program which is part of the Vancouver Coastal Health Research Institute. The VGH Emergency Department (ED) treats 90,000 of the most complex and critically ill patients in the province annually. VGH Emergency Department includes over 50 physicians with Royal College specialist certification in emergency medicine, 200 nurses and numerous ancillary staff. The VGH EM Research Program conducts numerous internal and external projects that are recruiting participants from the VGH ED. We have a research office located centrally in the ED, a Research Director and a research advisory committee.

The road safety research team focuses on drug impaired driving, traffic policy evaluation, outcome after road trauma, and active transportation. Most of the analyst's work will pertain to road safety research, specifically data analysis for a large inception cohort study of outcome after road trauma. This project investigates health related quality of life following road trauma, recovery trajectory, and risk factors for a poor recovery. A similar project focusing on active transport (cyclist and pedestrian injuries) of recovery is planned. Although the focus will be on road safety, the analyst may, with the Research Director's approval, provide statistical consultation for other VGH EM Research Program investigators and/or EM residents.

The Statistical Analyst reports to the Principal Investigator, Dr Jeff Brubacher. The incumbent will work collaboratively with other team members to manage and analyze data. The analyst will interact with other research team members and with external collaborators including policy makers, data custodians, and other road safety stakeholders as well as medical students, residents and healthcare professionals both within and outside the Department of Emergency Medicine.
Work Performed

Collaborates with other researchers and statisticians in the identification and completion of assigned research projects. The incumbent will write statistical reports, present the results in scheduled meetings and participate in writing scientific journal papers.
Manages complex large datasets using a variety of software and languages to explore data validity, develop research variables and conduct statistical analysis.
Works with multiple study designs.
Plans, performs and interprets statistical data analysis.
Identifies problems with data and suggests options to the PIs and data manager.
Ensures that all required confidentiality, privacy and data security processes are followed.
Works with PI and research team to develop and write the analysis plan and methods sections for grant applications and for research manuscripts and scientific journals.
Prepares written reports to summarize results for quick dissemination to stakeholders and funders.
Mentors students and residents, delegates work to the team members.
Presents posters at conferences, writes academic manuscripts and technical reports.
Performs other duties as required.
Supervision Received

The incumbent works independently on a day-to-day basis. The incumbent receives overall direction from the Principal Investigator. The incumbent meets with the Principal Investigator and research team on a weekly basis and more often as required.
Supervision Given
The incumbent will provide guidance on analytic issues to other investigators, residents and students as requested by the Principal Investigator.
Consequence of Error/Judgement

Our projects are under tight timelines. The impact of incorrect decisions and errors in judgment would delay productivity and/or loss of data integrity. In the most extreme scenario, the delay in reporting of results to funders would result in loss of operating funds. Inappropriate handling of confidential and sensitive data would result in the loss of privilege in conducting research with the administrative data and could harm future collaboration with data custodians. The incumbent is expected to alert the PIs to any unusual situations, which may affect the project, and to keep the PIs advised of problems that have arisen or that can be anticipated.
Qualifications

Post-graduate degree in Statistics. Minimum of two years experience in research analysis or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Previous experience working with large databases is required. Previous experience with statistical modeling including generalized linear mixed models, ARIMA, techniques for accommodating spatial and temporal correlation, and GIS mapping are required. Familiarity with British Columbia police crash data (the Traffic Accident System), ICBC claims data, and British Columbia Ambulance Service data is required. Sound knowledge in computation and statistics are essential, including efficient coding to process large volumes of data. Demonstrated knowledge of appropriate statistical methods for various study designs, such as interrupted time series, case-crossover, and matched cohort studies. Effective oral and written communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills. Ability to exercise appropriate tact, discretion and confidentiality in all matters. Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines. Ability to work effectively both independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Ability to work a flexible schedule and additional hours occasionally on weekends may be required.

Equity and diversity are essential to academic excellence. An open and diverse community fosters the inclusion of voices that have been underrepresented or discouraged. We encourage applications from members of groups that have been marginalized on any grounds enumerated under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.
All qualified candidates are encouraged to apply

Full-Time

Guiding principle: ""Midpoint"" of the hiring salary range means the individual possesses full job knowledge, qualifications and experience.
Job Summary

The Statistical Analyst will provide analytic and reporting expertise to the Principal Investigator and other members of the research team. This involves accessing data provided by partner organizations, creating datasets for the purposes of analyses, planning analysis, conducting the analyses, and reporting the results.
Organizational Status

The vision of the UBC Department of Emergency Medicine is to be a provincially integrated Department committed to clinical and academic leadership in the creation and exchange of knowledge to promote excellence in emergency care. Our faculty members across the province have had an impressive record of research and discovery. Our research and innovation initiatives include 14 successful programs related to prevention of emergencies, improving clinical care, and system improvements. Road Safety Research is one of the key strategic initiatives of the UBC Department of Emergency Medicine.

The road safety research team is also affiliated with the Vancouver General Hospital (VGH) Emergency Medicine (EM) Research Program which is part of the Vancouver Coastal Health Research Institute. The VGH Emergency Department (ED) treats 90,000 of the most complex and critically ill patients in the province annually. VGH Emergency Department includes over 50 physicians with Royal College specialist certification in emergency medicine, 200 nurses and numerous ancillary staff. The VGH EM Research Program conducts numerous internal and external projects that are recruiting participants from the VGH ED. We have a research office located centrally in the ED, a Research Director and a research advisory committee.

The road safety research team focuses on drug impaired driving, traffic policy evaluation, outcome after road trauma, and active transportation. Most of the analyst's work will pertain to road safety research, specifically data analysis for a large inception cohort study of outcome after road trauma. This project investigates health related quality of life following road trauma, recovery trajectory, and risk factors for a poor recovery. A similar project focusing on active transport (cyclist and pedestrian injuries) of recovery is planned. Although the focus will be on road safety, the analyst may, with the Research Director's approval, provide statistical consultation for other VGH EM Research Program investigators and/or EM residents.

The Statistical Analyst reports to the Principal Investigator, Dr Jeff Brubacher. The incumbent will work collaboratively with other team members to manage and analyze data. The analyst will interact with other research team members and with external collaborators including policy makers, data custodians, and other road safety stakeholders as well as medical students, residents and healthcare professionals both within and outside the Department of Emergency Medicine.
Work Performed

Collaborates with other researchers and statisticians in the identification and completion of assigned research projects. The incumbent will write statistical reports, present the results in scheduled meetings and participate in writing scientific journal papers.
Manages complex large datasets using a variety of software and languages to explore data validity, develop research variables and conduct statistical analysis.
Works with multiple study designs.
Plans, performs and interprets statistical data analysis.
Identifies problems with data and suggests options to the PIs and data manager.
Ensures that all required confidentiality, privacy and data security processes are followed.
Works with PI and research team to develop and write the analysis plan and methods sections for grant applications and for research manuscripts and scientific journals.
Prepares written reports to summarize results for quick dissemination to stakeholders and funders.
Mentors students and residents, delegates work to the team members.
Presents posters at conferences, writes academic manuscripts and technical reports.
Performs other duties as required.
Supervision Received

The incumbent works independently on a day-to-day basis. The incumbent receives overall direction from the Principal Investigator. The incumbent meets with the Principal Investigator and research team on a weekly basis and more often as required.
Supervision Given
The incumbent will provide guidance on analytic issues to other investigators, residents and students as requested by the Principal Investigator.
Consequence of Error/Judgement

Our projects are under tight timelines. The impact of incorrect decisions and errors in judgment would delay productivity and/or loss of data integrity. In the most extreme scenario, the delay in reporting of results to funders would result in loss of operating funds. Inappropriate handling of confidential and sensitive data would result in the loss of privilege in conducting research with the administrative data and could harm future collaboration with data custodians. The incumbent is expected to alert the PIs to any unusual situations, which may affect the project, and to keep the PIs advised of problems that have arisen or that can be anticipated.
Qualifications

Post-graduate degree in Statistics. Minimum of two years experience in research analysis or the equivalent combination of education and experience. Previous experience working with large databases is required. Previous experience with statistical modeling including generalized linear mixed models, ARIMA, techniques for accommodating spatial and temporal correlation, and GIS mapping are required. Familiarity with British Columbia police crash data (the Traffic Accident System), ICBC claims data, and British Columbia Ambulance Service data is required. Sound knowledge in computation and statistics are essential, including efficient coding to process large volumes of data. Demonstrated knowledge of appropriate statistical methods for various study designs, such as interrupted time series, case-crossover, and matched cohort studies. Effective oral and written communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills. Ability to exercise appropriate tact, discretion and confidentiality in all matters. Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines. Ability to work effectively both independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Ability to work a flexible schedule and additional hours occasionally on weekends may be required.

Equity and diversity are essential to academic excellence. An open and diverse community fosters the inclusion of voices that have been underrepresented or discouraged. We encourage applications from members of groups that have been marginalized on any grounds enumerated under the B.C. Human Rights Code, including sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

About Hear Québec

Hear Québec is the only registered nonprofit organization in Québec which serves Anglophones affected by hearing loss. Hear Québec has been providing ongoing programs, services and support to the hard of hearing community in and around the greater Montreal area since 1979, 40 years. Many of our team and board members are people affected by hearing loss. We understand and are concerned with the struggles and the difficulties that people with hearing difficulties often experience in their daily lives.

Hear Québec’s mandate is not only to offer ongoing programs and services but also to connect and inspire those affected by hearing loss, thereby helping to improve the quality of life and counter isolation. Hear Québec’s various programs help to raise awareness about the potential consequences of hearing loss, such as isolation, depression, anger, and dementia, to name a few. As a largely “invisible” disability, there are many “myths” and misconceptions about hearing loss. Our vision is a community where we can hear, be heard and thrive.
Job Description

Data analysts will organize and make sense of collections of information in order to make a functional database. They will maintain existing data in order for the organization to make logistical steps forward. Updating and developing a database of service providers i.e. Ear, Nose and Throat Doctors (ENTs), Audiologists etc, to add to the current repertoire. This collection of resource and services providers does not currently exist for the official language minority English community living in Quebec that needs to access these services in their local communities. The candidate will reach out and engage local business, hearing health professional and community partners.

All of this information will be digitized and incorporated into our website, contact relation management systems (CRM )and made accessible through multiple media platforms. The youth will be responsible for contacting our current members through the telephone. Our current staff members have hearing loss and communicating over the telephone can be extremely difficult. The student will then use this information to update our membership information on the contact relation management systems. The student will also be responsible for updating, managing and organizing our current cloud computing services.

We are looking for someone who will be an ambitious and dedicated contributor to our team. Not only is this an opportunity for promising career growth, but meaningful work awaits both on business and technology fronts.
The successful candidate will be responsible for:
Market research and the delivery/interpretation of industry analysis
Communicate with multiple stakeholders concerning requirements, project status, and issues to align business strategies with technology solutions
Establish and maintain standards for consistent dashboard and reporting formats
Solves technical issues/processes and understands complex details and supports one or more business processes
Bringing a high level of verbal and interpersonal communication skills to relate to other business and technology partners
Sourcing innovative solutions for intricate and difficult situations through strong resource and problem solving abilities.
Job Requirements
What You Bring to TD

Currently enrolled in an undergraduate technology-related degree, such as Business Administration, Commerce, Business Technology Management, Information Technology Management, Economics, or Technology Sciences
A curiosity and passion in technology
Creative market research and analysis abilities in order to stay current with trends relating to FinTechs and new technologies
Strong communication skills (oral and written)
Experience presenting data visually and creatively
Exceptional Excel / data management skills
Excellent verbal & written communication with ability to work effectively in a team environment
Ability to develop good business relationships with customers, business partners and stakeholders

This position is a 4-month work term and will commence January 6, 2020.

analyst - Data Management and Anonymization Centre,"Montréal, QC",Desjardins,,"Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-09
As an analyst at Desjardins Group's Data Management and Masking Centre, you are a key player in delivering our overall service offer to project teams that solicit our services.
During your analysis, you help align the business rules used, define the type of masking required, and provide and have your work estimates approved for the project.
Throughout the process, you ensure adherence to the security and compliance teams' rules and standards.

You advise and assist team members, clients and partners as part of important intervention initiatives related to data confidentiality standards. You help solve complex problems. Coordination among co-workers and key players is critical. Therefore, a strong team spirit and a willingness to collaborate are paramount. You will interact in Agile mode with various groups and players in complementary fields.
Curiosity and strong analytical skills are essential to succeed in this position. You must also be client -focused and have good written and oral communication skills.
Your initiatives and projects require extensive knowledge of database management systems (DBMSs) and script programming languages, such as PowerShell.
You serve as resource person for your unit, clients and partners. This position also requires the ability to quickly assimilate new tools, technologies and processes.
Additional responsibilities
Compile partners' requirements and needs with a view to transforming data in a secure and appropriate manner.
Develop masking solutions that comply with current standards and processes.
Manage and prioritize backlog activities.
Use the tools available, e.g., Casewise.
Support developers until the solution is delivered.
Work as a team to develop common objectives, to improve processes/automation/existing roles (Analyst / Developer / work monitoring).
Use tracking tools to record your activities and document them for future reference.
Other working conditions
Place of work: Montreal or Lévis, depending on the preference of the candidate
Number of jobs available: 2
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
A minimum of four years of relevant experience
Experience in manual process automation
Experience using data anonymization processes and tools
Experience processing and using DBMSs
Experience in the banking sector (an asset)
Please note that other combinations of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered
For vacant positions available in Quebec, please note that knowledge of French is required
Specific knowledge
Proficiency in DB2 and IMS
Extensive knowledge of data modelling principles
Extensive knowledge of Windows tools: .NET, PowerShell, etc.
Extensive knowledge of Agile mode (Scrumban, JIRA tool)
Knowledge of various data storage mechanisms
Knowledge of CA-TDM software or another data anonymization tool
Knowledge of fundamentals of system capacity/performance and disk space management
Knowledge of Java programming
Knowledge of Web APIs
Knowledge of schedulers: Control-M, Autosys, etc.
Independent speaker, intermediate knowledge of English
Desjardins Cross-sector skills
Action oriented, Collaborates, Customer Focus, Innovation

Montreal - Junior Business Analyst/ Junior Project Manager,"Montréal, QC",FDM Group,,"COVID-19 Update: At FDM, it’s ‘business as usual’, we are recruiting now and throughout the year. Due to COVID-19, we have implemented alternative working arrangements to ensure that all our people stay safe. These consist of remote working, virtual training, video interviewing, and access to webinars and virtual events. We have training start dates happening throughout the year. If you’re looking to start your career in technology or business, we want to hear from you now!

Note: Please only submit one application, even if you are interested in more than one opportunity. A recruiter will speak to you about all options available after we review your application. Please note this role is part of our graduate program.
***Scroll down for French ***

Do you thrive in fast-paced technical environments and have a strong attention to detail? Are you eager to have a career where you are encouraged to meet your potential and have the opportunity to work for a prestigious company with an impressive global presence?

FDM is currently seeking a number of ambitious and driven candidates with the aptitude for IT to work as FDM consultants with our top clients, many of which are leading companies in the banking and financial services industry.

FDM creates and inspires exciting careers that shape our digital future. Through our Careers Program, we recruit and train those aspiring to become IT and business professionals before deploying them on to client sites worldwide. With centres across Europe, North America and APAC, FDM has shown exponential growth throughout the years, firmly establishing itself as an award-winning FTSE 250 employer.

Junior Business Analyst or Junior Project Manager roles often involve access to business areas in major financial institutions, working on sensitive information and high profile projects, and gaining first-hand exposure to the trade lifecycle. The role is crucial in helping organizations with the accuracy and timely presentation of data, in line with internal process, governance, and regulatory requirements. These opportunities are perfect for those who are team players with strong analytical skills and an aptitude for fast learning.
What we offer you:
Industry recognized training and qualifications
Key skills development
A minimum of two years commercial experience working with some of the world’s most reputable organizations
Mentoring and on-going support throughout your career with FDM
Essential Criteria:
4 year university degree or college/Cégep diploma (preferably in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar)
A strong aptitude in IT and the interest and drive to expand your IT skill set
Previous experience Excel VBA, SQL, Unix
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
A problem solver with a keen eye for detail
A desire to work at a large financial firm and ability to increase your financial knowledge
Able to engage yourself in a project and enjoy the challenges and processes involved
Flexible, eager, ambitious, and adaptable to change
Flexible to relocate to Toronto for the duration of training
Able to commit to work for FDM for a minimum of two years working as an FDM consultant following the training period
Eligible to work in Canada (citizen/permanent resident/work permit with sufficient length of validity)
Fluent in English and French

FDM is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or any other status protected by federal, provincial or local laws.

Specialist Business Intelligence Performance Measurement and...,"Vancouver, BC",PHSA,,"Reporting to the Lead, Data Architecture, the Specialist, Business Intelligence is responsible for the planning, design, development and management of new and existing data warehouse and analytics solutions related to various PHSA programs and services. Applying a broad range of information technology experience, Data Warehousing (DW), Business Intelligence (BI), and clinical and operational knowledge, the Business Intelligence Specialist works with stakeholders to develop analytical products that meet their analytical, reporting, monitoring, surveillance and evaluation needs. This position plans, designs, and develops BI and analytical solutions, including data Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, data marts, reports and dashboards as part of the overall PHSA Enterprise Data Warehouse. This position ensures the integrity and quality of the data accessible through these solutions, and also manages and maintains the metadata and other product documentations.
What you’ll do:

Architect and implement analytics solutions to develop, enhance and improve analytics and use of data at various PHSA programs and external stakeholders. This includes leading the design, development, documentation and implementation of complex data marts, multidimensional cubes or other semantic models, reports, dashboards and other front-end interfaces.

Architect and implement optimal database schemas and ETL solutions to integrate data from various source systems into integrated linked data marts. Collaborate with other members of the team on conceptual design, development, and implementation of the Enterprise Data Warehouse.

Lead the identification of new data sources and implements data extraction routines from departmental feeder systems. Provides advice and direction on data availability and quality. Consults and problem-solves with feeder departments regarding routine data extracts.

Participate in the development, definition and reporting of performance indicators as related to program operations, access and throughput, for use at the program director and executive level. Liaise on behalf of the agency with external consultants on the provisioning of patient specific data, as well as providing education on analysis and interpretation.

Provide technical expertise in the development of Analytics and Business Intelligence solutions by assessing client needs and requirements, reviewing technical options, determining the design and architecture and leading all levels of the solution development and deployment.

Ensure the designed solutions meet the established architectural, security, and quality standards set by the department by actively engaging peers and leads in design and review processes. Maintain current metadata, definitions and documentation of the solutions.

Maintain familiarity with the latest on-premises and cloud analytics technologies, and an awareness of current clinical and business information system trends and issues. Evaluate and recommend products or methods to deliver analytics and Business Intelligence in an accurate, timely and user friendly manner.
Mentor other developers and team members and provide technical and educational support to end users by developing training materials, delivering training sessions and training trainers.
Represent Performance Measurement & Reporting on committees at various levels with regard to data standards, appropriate usage, availability and quality.
What you bring:

A level of education, training, and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Health Information Science, Management Information Systems or a related field, plus 5 years of recent BI, data warehousing, data modelling or analytics experience. Strong understanding of health care system operations and public and population health concepts is definite asset.
Advanced knowledge, and experience in application of best practices of data standards, database design, data architecture and modelling.
Expertise in developing ETL solutions, relational and multi-dimensional databases and data marts.
Superior database querying, and query optimization skills using Structured Query Language -preferably T-SQL, MDX or DAX or equivalents.
Advanced knowledge of and experience with BI and visualizations tools such as Microsoft Power BI, and Tableau, and collaboration solutions such as SharePoint.

Proven hands-on experience with standard data warehousing and Business Intelligence tools such as Microsoft SQL Server, Integration Services (SSIS), Analysis Services (SSAS), Reporting Services (SSRS), and related development tools and version control tools, or comparable technologies from other vendors.

Working knowledge of big data technologies, data science methods and languages such as (Python, R) and Windows and web application development tools and languages is an asset. High level of expertise in Microsoft Office suite of applications.
Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas in simple terminology with internal and external contacts.
Demonstrated ability to analyze operational problems and recommend innovative solutions.

Strong analytical, problem solving and system analysis skills including the ability to comprehend complex large scale health care environment operational issues and related data/information and present information in concise meaningful ways.
Customer focused with ability to facilitate and encourage cooperation between professionals from other disciplines.
Ability to understand management reporting and statistical concepts.
Ability to educate and lead management staff on the importance of using high quality data for decision making, via business intelligence tools and other means.
Self-directed and motivated to learn new tools and technology.
Ability to work independently with little direct supervision and as a member of a multi-disciplinary team.
Excellent time management skills with the ability to organize and prioritize work.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the job. Persistence and a positive attitude are essential given the iterative development cycle and sometimes problematic data integration issues.
What’s in it for you:

Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth and development.
Access to more than 2,000 in-house training programs.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan.
12 annual statutory holidays with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
Perks include onsite fitness classes and discounts to 350 BC-wide recreational programs, travel, technology, car and bike sharing, and more.
Job type: Regular Full-Time
Number of positions: 3
Location: 1333 W. Broadway Vancouver, BC
Closing date: Open until positions are filled
Reference number: 90280
What we do:

PHSA plans, coordinates and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose. Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services.

PHSA is committed to employment equity and hires on the basis of merit, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, backgrounds and experiences, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

The Data Analyst will focus on a wide spectrum of activities associated with data management applications, systems and processes and will oversee the management and utilization of the department’s data and reporting.

This position will become an overall system “super-user” with focus on the continued development, improvement and maintenance of tools and processes to improve workflow and efficiencies within the department. This position will also provide long-term ongoing communications and support to management and system stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities

Overall management of department’s data applications, databases and warehouses including Enablon, Power BI and SharePoint and act as a single point of contact and provide expert advice to all users/stakeholders.
Development of regular (i.e., weekly, monthly, quarterly) reports based on current statistics, including the identification and presentation of data trends.
Rapid response to management requests for data extraction to support various department communications and initiatives.
Management and modification of data libraries and fields in order to create a more structured data framework.
Participation in special projects as assigned.
Maintenance and oversight of data transmission with department’s third-party consultants.
Provide support and training to application users.
Administrator access gatekeeper to application users.
Qualifications and Professional Experience
Bachelor’s degree in a business or systems background, or equivalent.
3 + years business experience supporting multi-application systems, reporting, and training.

Minimum one year of direct experience with use of EHS software applications (Enablon, Power BI, etc.) at Administrative level. Proficient in the use of Microsoft software applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Data analysis and trending experience across various levels.
Possess a deep understanding of reporting and analytics capabilities within data management systems.
Experience working in the field of Environment and/or EHS and knowledge of Environment and/or EHS policies and standards.
Intermediate experience managing and improving EHS data systems and processes, such as identifying opportunities to streamline and/or improve efficiency of work.
Other Requirements and Information
Effective communication skills across all levels of the organization, both verbally and in writing.
Initiative, accuracy and a strong attention to detail.
Stakeholder management and appropriate management of confidential information are essential.
Proven ability to critique assumptions, practices and ways of operating and will generate ideas and solutions that create value and promote innovation, knowledge sharing and learning.
We Build Careers and Pipelines That Last

Our story is about determination, resourcefulness and resilience. It’s about charting our own course, finding innovative solutions to challenging problems and doing the right thing. It was true when Trans Mountain became a company in 1951 and it’s just as true today. We welcome new members to our team that embrace the qualities in our story, that thrive on the new path and directions we take. Our culture is one of care and taking our responsibilities seriously. If you would like to contribute to our culture, then join our journey.

A place to share a sense of purpose and build relationships.
Meaningful work that makes a difference.
An opportunity within the Canadian energy industry.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

MAXIMUS Canada is an industry leader in the provisioning of products and services to support the delivery of government services in North America and internationally. Customer Focus

Data Analyst,"Toronto, ON",Ontario Institute for Cancer Research,,"The Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (OICR) is seeking a Data Analyst to work within the Ontario Health Study (OHS) team.

The Ontario Health Study has recruited over 225,000 participants across Ontario, and data holdings include multiple questionnaires, physical measures, analyses of blood samples, environmental exposures, and genetic data. These data require review and preparation before they are ready to provide to researchers to conduct investigator-initiated research projects. The Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data from multiple sources, data cleaning, defining data transformations and mapping rules, data verification and documentation, creating research-ready datasets to support genetic and epidemiological research projects, and providing support and consultation to other Study staff. While this position provides the opportunity to work with a large volume of different types of data, the role does not include leading analyses for research publications. The position provides an opportunity to work within a supportive, collaborative team as part of the province’s largest health research study.
Find out more about what’s happening at the Ontario Health Study
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Define the approach to data cleaning and the data preparation process
Define, transform, structure and verify the data so it is ready for analysis (i.e., data cleaning)
Create and maintain documentation for data, including data dictionaries
Complete data integrity checks (e.g., descriptive statistics) to ensure consistency with previously reported data, and reconcile any differences
Work closely with others to explore and report on data quality issues or risks with the data, and identify opportunities for enhancements
Act as a resource to the OHS team and the research community on selected data-related issues
Gain and share expertise in specific OHS data holdings
Prepare performance metrics reports
Contribute to the development of reports for various stakeholders, including ad-hoc reporting for executives and funders

Extract data from large databases and prepare the data for analyses by internal and external researchers. This includes data validation, de-identification, and preparing written documentation describing data specifications

A minimum of 2 years practical and related experience required
Experience in a health research environment is required
Knowledge of health research methodology, qualitative and quantitative data collection and analysis techniques
Strong statistical skills, including computational analysis using R and/or SAS
Proven experience with health-related data cleaning, data transformations, and data analysis
Proven in-depth knowledge and best practices of multi-source data quality strategies
Knowledge of relevant data quality processes, and initiative in resolving data anomalies
Ability to integrate data and research concepts, and exercise good judgement
Ability to develop and maintain strong working relationships with colleagues
Experience working with longitudinal data with a large number of participants is preferred
Familiarity with MySQL an asset
Ability to write clear, concise documentation
Eager to learn, take on new challenges, work as part of a broader team, and enthusiastic and passionate about all things “data”

OICR is an innovative cancer research institute located in the MaRS Centre in the Discovery District in downtown Toronto. OICR is addressing significant challenges in cancer research with multi-disciplinary, multi-institutional teams. Rewind is looking for a detail oriented Business Intelligence Manager to join our Data team and support Rewind’s upcoming growth plans to be the only service your business needs to protect its valuable data!
About Rewind

Rewind is a service that protects the data that is driving your business, from a simple side hustle to a successful venture. Our focus is on backing up data that lives in the cloud – specifically in apps like Shopify, BigCommerce, and QuickBooks Online. We invite you to read our startup story to learn where we came from and where we’re going. For a more technical view, check out our Behind the App feature on the BigCommerce Developers Blog.
We care about honesty, we believe in learning from our mistakes, and we support each other as we grow.
About the Job

Reporting to the Controller, the Business Intelligence Manager will take ownership of building and managing our data function and be a key strategic partner at Rewind. As a Business Intelligence Manager, you will collaborate with departments across the organization to understand our data sources and needs, set up the processes and delivery on it (including data warehouse, tools, ETL, integrations), and improve performance measurement to make informed decisions. You will be responsible for building, sharing, and advising on key metrics of the business, developing and implementing a data and governance strategy, and enhancing our data-driven culture. You can expect to:
Oversee the planning and implementation of Rewind’s data warehouse,BI tools, ETL process, and integration capabilities

Partnering with other departments to define what business problem they are trying to solve, with what sources of data, when is it due, how it will add value, and deliver on the reporting, dashboards, and automation as needed
Monitor and analyze market trends, customer behaviours, buying patterns and sales performance
Track the performance of sales and marketing campaigns / experiments and help build predictive models
Create processes to triage internal requests and boost internal productivity by spending time on what’s important
Optimize processes and operational performance by reducing time spent on data entry and manipulation
Benchmark data against competitor and historical data for continuous improvements
Supporting the finance team in building business cases for capital allocation
About You
We are looking for candidates with 5 years of experience in a business intelligence or data analytics role
You may have a Bachelor’s degree in business technology management, computer science, or equivalent experience
You should have:
An obsession with accuracy
Strong written and verbal communication skills, can effectively communicate and work with departments to translate business requirements to technical requirements
Strong, hands-on experience with Excel and SQL, relational databases, data modelling, dashboarding and reporting, with the ability to interpret findings and produce meaningful insights
Experience with scripting in languages (e.g. Python, Ruby)
Strong curiosity for uncovering strategic opportunities and creativity in solving business problems
Proven ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, managing competing priorities on multiple simultaneous projects
Previous B2B or SaaS experience is considered an asset
As we are working remotely, communication skills are critical. We appreciate those who have strong interpersonal, written, and verbal communication skills.
You should also be excited to join a rapidly growing team!
About our Hiring Process

You can expect us to be curious about who you are, what experiences you have gained to date and what you are looking for in your next opportunity. We know that you are selecting us as an employer just as much as we are inviting you to join our team. We will provide a series of opportunities for us to connect and for you to meet various members of our team. Please ask us questions and let us know how we can support you throughout our hiring process.

Experience comes in many forms, many skills are transferable, and passion goes a long way. If your background is close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying, even if you aren’t able to check every box above. We don’t hire people to fill boxes - each new hire is an opportunity for us to augment our collective perspective and to make us a stronger team… and that is where you come in!

We are dedicated to providing an inclusive and supportive workplace where all of our teammates can bring their full and authentic selves to work... everyday. As a proud equal opportunity employer, we consider all applicants for employment and certainly invite those who identify as members of underrepresented communities to apply and join our team! And hey - we may not have a role available today that would be exciting to you, but we are growing fast and would love to have you join our talent community.

About OLIVER:

OLIVER believes that agencies work better inside a brand's organization – delivering more effective work at the speed and flexibility required to drive modern businesses forward. Using our unique methodology, and supported by bespoke technology, we design, build, and operate specialist, dedicated agencies onsite with our clients. We believe that proximity enables better collaboration, leading to better marketing solutions.

Established in 2004, our model is now driven by nearly 3,000 people worldwide, working across more than 200 in-house agencies in over 25 countries. We are the undisputed leader in our space, which means we carry the responsibility and humility that comes with breaking new ground, continually evolving one of the most transformative agency models in history. People who join OLIVER come to us from all stages of their careers, from entry-level to agency veteran. They find a culture of entrepreneurism, direct and meaningful client impact, deep collaboration across offices and teams, and frankly, a bit of the unknown. If you're most comfortable in safe, predictable environments, OLIVER may not be for you. That said, we will also give you the support, tools, feedback, and recognition to be your best – we want you to achieve what you strive for. The opportunities for growth are as wide as you can make them.
Our Values and how to live them
Ambition. You look for opportunities to deliver greater value to those around you
Imagination. You identify a range of solutions to problems
Inspiration. You lead by example and encourage others to do the same
Learning. You have excellent listening skills that helps you to learn from our clients and those around you.
Results. You accept responsibility for your actions
