Business Systems Analyst,"London, ON",Canada Life Assurance Company,,"Job Description:
Role Description

The Group Customer Technology (GCT) Business Systems Analyst maintains a “business perspective” through all phases of project delivery and systems enhancement. Business Systems Analysts work closely with their business clients and other stakeholder departments to understand business needs, opportunities, and requirements. Working in a team environment, the Business Systems Analyst is responsible for:
Representing their client’s business requirements,
Defining and designing the business functionality of the system, and
Ensuring that the system meets the defined business requirements and delivers value to stakeholders.

The Business Systems Analyst along with the Project Manager, Architect, and Lead Developer forms a project leadership team positively contributing to the team environment by acting as a leader, mentor, and guide to the entire project team.

Within the Canada Life Analysis Community of Practice, the analyst strives to be a strong and participating member where they hold each other accountable to become a best in class option for our business partners and provide top tier benefits and services by adhering to the following principles:
Simplify the complex and effectively communicate both Group Customer Technology (GCT) and business visions
Value integrity by embracing honesty and maintaining strong principles
Maintain a high level of technical and business knowledge
Provide guidance and leadership to our projects and account teams
Establish credibility and trust across our Group Customer Technology (GCT) team and business partners
Accountabilities:
Defining and maintaining business architecture through conceptual business models
Defining business problems/opportunities, providing a clear definition and performing benefit analysis
Performing business and systems analysis and design, articulating the logical design alternatives and recommending appropriate solutions
Performing functional analysis and design, defining and documenting detailed business requirements and leading the usability perspective of the project
Performing software development activities where appropriate

Working with Quality Assurance (QA) team members to ensure adequate testing, and that the system meets business expectations by establishing the full traceability of test strategies, plans, and test cases back to business requirements.
Contributing to training strategies and business implementation planning
Providing leadership to business partners and team members
Participation within the Analysis Community of Practice to promote and develop the Business Systems Analyst role
Being actively aware of the Summary Role Profile for the Business Systems Analyst related to performance assessments
Qualifications and Competencies:
Post-secondary Degree or equivalent experience in Information Technology
Good understanding of business principles and experience with a broad range of different types of business functions
Understanding of Agile project methodologies, processes and practices, and experience with functional systems analysis and design
Strong business process modeling skills, logical data modeling skills and object-oriented skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills that rely on a structured approach to problem solving
Progressive technical experience in one or more of the following areas:
C/UNIX
Oracle PL/SQL
.Net
Effective internal consulting skills with a strong customer service orientation
Communicates in a clear and concise manner, both written and verbal, that is appropriate for the audience
Good interpersonal skills and a demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment
Able to pivot and quickly change direction in response to changing priorities while effectively performing under pressure
Effective planning and organizational skills
Good understanding of information technology/information systems.
Desire for continuous professional development to ensure best in class offerings
Our Story

Canada Life is a leading insurance, wealth management and benefits provider focused on improving the financial, physical and mental well-being of Canadians. For more than 170 years, individuals, families and business owners across Canada have trusted us to provide sound guidance and deliver on the promises we’ve made.

As of January 1, 2020, Great-West Life, London Life and Canada Life became one company – Canada Life, and today, we proudly serve more than 13 million customer relationships from coast to coast to coast.
Discover your opportunity….Apply today!

Canada Life offers competitive compensation, great benefits such as medical, dental, life insurance, wellness account and personal days not to mention onsite cafeteria and fitness in our head office facilities. If you’d like to join our team submit your information online and introduce yourself.

Canada Life serves the financial security needs of more than 13 million people across Canada, with additional operations in Europe and the United States. As members of the Power Financial Corporation group of companies, we’re one of Canada’s leading insurers with interests in life insurance, health insurance, investment and retirement savings. We offer a broad portfolio of financial and benefit plan solutions for individuals, families, businesses and organizations.

We are committed to providing an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live, and to creating an environment where every employee has the opportunity to reach their potential.
Canada Life would like to thank all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted

SAP Business Analyst,"Georgetown, ON",Mold-Masters,,"Position Summary:

We have an opening for an SAP Business Analyst – Materials Management (MM) for our Georgetown, Ontario, Canada location. The analyst is responsible for analyzing and evaluating existing/proposed system and using experience devises processes and procedures as potential solutions for the business. Due to advanced functional and enterprise-wide knowledge the candidate is expected to provide training, mentoring and support to Materials Management (MM) Users across all Mold-Masters organizations. This position is the primary support for SAP at our facility in Kunshan China.
Who we are:

Mold-Masters® is a world-leading supplier of hot runner technology and systems. We design, manufacture and support a full range of hot runner products that are used in the injection molding production of plastic products - from automotive to everyday consumer items.

Mold-Masters® is an operating company of Hillenbrand. Hillenbrand (www.Hillenbrand.com) is a global diversified industrial company with businesses that serve a wide variety of industries around the world. We pursue profitable growth and robust cash generation to drive increased value for our shareholders. Hillenbrand's portfolio includes industrial businesses such as Coperion, Milacron Injection Molding & Extrusion, and Mold-Masters, in addition to Batesville, a recognized leader in the death care industry in North America. Hillenbrand is publicly traded on the NYSE under ""HI.""
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:

· Support MM Users in SAP and related business areas (e.g. Vendor/Purchasing interfaces and other MM integrated software applications) across all Mold-Masters locations and primarily for Mold-Masters Kunshan China facility
· Create/recommend/implement business processes and objectives as they relate to the SAP systems
· Perform configuration work to support new and existing functionality (assist outside consultants in System configuration/testing)
· Document and maintain all MM related business processes and procedures for Mold-Masters Kunshan
· Train end users on new and existing MM processes and business systems for Mold-Masters Kunshan
· Investigate unused or new SAP functionality and recommend enhancements or process improvements as appropriate
· Act as liaison between SAP MM Users and technical programming staff (or outside consultants) on enhancements, new reports, queries, printed forms, interfaces, etc
· Searching for potential solutions to SAP “bugs”, logging any issues, following up with SAP (or other help/support desk) on potential solutions, and testing and implementing fixes
· Assist in the implementation and testing of new releases, upgrades, or patches of SAP (or related systems)
· Ensure appropriate User security/authorization levels exist in the MM area, and coordinating/testing any required authorization changes
· Participate in (and occasionally lead) initiatives involved in MM process/software implementations
· Maintain confidentiality for business-critical data including company-wide business performance, activities, direction, and other sensitive information
· Understanding of other SAP modules integration to MM (i.e. FI/CO, SD, PP, etc)
· Ensure ISO guidelines are followed
Skills/Experience:

A strong attention to detail, ability to work in a fast-paced environment and excellent organizational skills are required. The incumbent must be capable of reading and interpreting documents such as process documentation, blueprints, operating and maintenance instructions and procedure manuals. The ability to write routine reports and to communicate effectively with employees, management, and external suppliers, is a requirement. With minimal direction, the SAP Business Analyst will act as a key technical resource in the implementation, interpretation and analysis of processes that validate cost-effective MM processes, controls and procedures. They will play an integral role in the implementation new functionality or enhancements of business practices by working with key MM stakeholders.

Senior Financial and Data Analyst,"Mississauga, ON",OnPharm-United,,"Urgently hiring
JOB DESCRIPTION-SENIOR FINANCIAL AND DATA ANALYST (ONPHARM-UNITED)

OnPharm-United is a buying and services group representing close to 600 independent pharmacy owners across Ontario. We are one of the largest and fastest growing networks of independent pharmacies in Canada.

OnPharm-United is looking to fill the position of Senior Financial and Data Analyst (“Analyst”). This is a highly complex and challenging role. We are looking for individuals with strong analytical minds, but also that are business savvy and have an ability to deliver data analytics and solutions that meet the requirements of the business and create efficiency, reduce errors and identify opportunities and threats to the success of the business. The Analyst supports the overall technical, reporting and analysis functions for OnPharm-United and will be responsible for several major functions which support the business including:
Responsibilities and Duties
a. Upcharge: Calculating upcharge payments to stores including determining store payments and auditing against external data sources (wholesaler data).
b. Working with the Vice President of Operations and finance team to track non-compliant stores and provide notification and recommendations to members on how to improve compliance.
c. Coordinate with external partners (including wholesalers) and internal staff to improve store performance and adherence to the program.
d. Formulary functions- Working closely with the formulary lead and formulary team to:
i. Review formulary allocations using proprietary software to ensure primary molecules are in stock and providing guidance and advice to the team and implementing switches as required.
ii. Advising dispensary software providers and other vendors of changes to the program as required.

iii. Work with the formulary team to implement processes and procedures aimed at tracking and improving store compliance and increasing efficiency for the program in terms of overall benefit to OnPharm-United and to our members.
iv. Work with other team members on other formulary initiatives as required.
e. Database functions- Maintain, update and store all financial and member databases.
f. Reporting- Provide standardized monthly reports and build new reports as required to track various business metrics and provide customized reports as required.
g. Develop and maintain tools, processes and procedures to increase company efficiency and better utilize data including

i. Developing a dashboard accessible to the Board and Senior management allowing them to track performance metrics for the company and for various programs (non-formulary, formulary, by wholesaler etc.)
ii. Develop and implement a plan on how to better utilize our data, including exploring and providing potential options on creating additional revenue streams.
iii. Offer insights, guidance and evaluations of all current business processes and data management and provide and implement solutions to improve over time.
Qualifications and Skills
1. Bachelor’s degree in economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering or other numerical discipline.
2 Proficiency with MS Excel (and creating macros), SQL, all other MS applications including PowerPoint, Access, and various Business Intelligence (BI) Systems and analytical tools.
3. Strong written and oral communication skills. Ability to communicate effectively to all levels (Executive, Board, and other staff) as well as with key stakeholders (business analysts, sales etc.).

4. Ability to effectively translate business requirements (from Executive) into concrete data analytics. Understanding strategy, needs and priorities of the organization and effectively implementing solutions and processes to help achieve those goals.
5. Minimum 7-10 years of relevant experience and a proven track record of using data to deliver on business requirements.
We offer a competitive salary and benefits package. We are a rapidly expanding company, and we are looking for a fast learner with ambition to grow and learn with the company.
Please note that job duties tend to change over time, and we reserve the right to assign you new duties or modify your job duties as may be required to meet Company objectives.

Company Profile

MAXIMUS Canada is an industry leader in the provisioning of products and services to support the delivery of government services in North America and internationally. With operations across Canada and around the globe, MAXIMUS provides innovative, practical and meaningful solutions to help government programs and services function more effectively and efficiently.

We are constantly assessing new technology, processes and methods of delivering services to the citizens of Canada. With our expertise in program information management, claims processing, contact centre services, document processing and information technology, we are positioned for significant growth.

MAXIMUS Canada offers competitive market-based salaries, comprehensive employer-paid benefits and a defined-benefit pension plan or a Group RSP with employer-matching contributions, for eligible employees. Our people also get some great perks too, such as employee appreciation events throughout the year, along with a supportive results-oriented work environment.

Join us here in beautiful Victoria, British Columbia to experience the best of the West Coast lifestyle. You will work in an environment that will challenge you and reward your achievements. Your downtime can be spent exploring all the West Coast has to offer – scenic beauty, culinary experiences, cultural events and outdoor activities. We have it all! Located in the heart of downtown, our location offers easy access to every amenity.
MAXIMUS Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Core Values

At MAXIMUS Canada, we believe that our culture strengthens our commitment to Helping Government Serve the People. We foster a culture that respects and values individual contributions and differences. At MAXIMUS Canada we believe in the following four core values:
Customer Focus

Our customers' business needs inform everything we do. We start by developing relationships built on trust and respect. We listen, and incorporate their diverse experience into our services and solutions, and we show our understanding with clear communication.
Disciplined Approach

With decades of experience delivering government programs, we balance tried and tested processes with a desire for continuous improvement. We take the time to plan and benchmark our performance – it's the path to success.
Results and Delivery
Great results depend on setting high, measurable standards of excellence and achieving the numbers. We challenge each other and hold one another accountable to our commitments.
A Great Place to Work

MAXIMUS Canada promotes a challenging work environment, empowering our employees to get the job done. If you want to work in an environment that recognizes and rewards accomplishments while caring about each other and the communities we serve, this could be the place for you.

On behalf of Maximus Canada and in support of our client business departments, the Technology Services Department provides services that supports them in delivering better outcomes for their clients. POSITION SUMMARY:

Katipult’s QA Team is looking for an Intermediate QA Analyst. The successful applicant will know how to work effectively with a continuous integration system, and will provide insight on the best methods to execute clear testing procedures within the company.

FirstOntario Credit Union is one of the largest credit unions in Ontario. We are a trusted co-operative financial intuition dedicated to providing competitive banking products and services and a quality Member service. More than 118,000 Ontarians choose FirstOntario for their financial needs – from chequing and savings accounts to loans and mortgages and highly qualified investment advice. Our Membership does more than save you money on fees, it also makes you an Owner. At FirstOntario, we believe the best way to ensure our success is by supporting the communities we serve. That’s why our policies include volunteering our time, talent and resources to worthy local causes and events. It’s also why we reinvest our profits in the same places they’re earned, and why we sponsor programs that promote financial literacy and economic development.
Job Overview

The Digital Business Analyst in the Digital Solutions team contributes to the overall success of the Digital Solutions team’s strategic vision and business objectives via the utilization of human centered design, project management and the Lean methodology. This role supports and leads the implementation of new products and services for FirstOntario digital platforms and supports a culture rooted in innovation and continuous improvement.
Role
In the role, you will…
· Consult and collaborate with a variety of internal stakeholders to better understand the business requirements, product needs and alternative solutions.
· Organize documentation for the project committee to review, and act as the owner by responding to inquiries
· Support business case creation, gathering requirements and information from various business units as the business owner
· Be systematic in your approach to creating pilots while integrating an Agile process to deliver rapid products and solicit feedback from users
· Prototype solutions and test innovative ideas to enhance our Member’s online experience
· Be involved in the execution of digital products and services including: all aspects of FirstOntario’s mobile, online banking and website platforms
· Support implementation of digital products and services on our mobile and online platforms
· Be a liaison between the information technology team and the business units throughout project creation to post-launch support
· Analyze data to identify trends, interdependencies among variables and be able to support defining project scope, developing action plans and gaining agreement to solutions from all stakeholders
· Diligently monitor industry trends and the competitive landscape, bringing fresh ideas to the table
· Proudly represent the Digital Solutions team on initiatives and projects ensuring impacts to employees, Members and shareholders are identified and processes are delivered
· Utilize Lean methodology to streamline work processes and realize cost and resource efficiencies
· Passionately pursue the improvement of the digital user experience that generates revenue to the business, includes reporting and analysis
· Perform other duties as we may need you to do
Required Skills
Within your skills and qualifications, you will…

· Have a strong business acumen with a post-secondary degree in Business, Marketing, or equivalent and/or have a minimum of five (5) years of hands of equivalent industry experience in digital product management
· Have basic knowledge of user interface design principles and user-centric design processes
· Have experience in project management or product management roles are preferred
· Have an understanding for the financial services industry and its products
· Proven analytical skills with the ability to apply results of analysis
· Be digitally savvy with an inherent interest in technology, innovation, business transformation, user centred design and digital user experience to understand how they all impact the business
· Use your understanding of the digital landscape, technologies, disrupters and best practices to drive innovative digital products and services that will impact business results
· Thrive in a collaborative, agile, fast pace, multi-tasking, solutions-focused environment that is driven by data

· Maintain and encourage open and honest business relationships within the team and with business partners to ensure the alignment of business objectives
· Naturally drive change through influence and collaboration and able to effectively manage relationships with project sponsors and stakeholders
· Have a strong background and comfort level in conducting research and then presenting your findings in the form of presentations or business cases
· Have excellent interpersonal, presentation, facilitation and engagement skills both verbal and written
· Desire to do the right things for the right reasons
This role offers a competitive compensation package.

General Accountability

The Analyst – PMO performs and/or coordinates the planning, monitoring, analysis and evaluation of project, program, and portfolio management functions for the applicable TTC Group and provides project management support, including budget preparation and monitoring, cost analysis, controls and reconciliations, and/or scheduling. The position receives direction from the Manager or the Advisor – PMO to assist in the overall planning, management and administration of their department’s project portfolio to ensure the ongoing success of the TTC Project Management Maturity Plan.

In addition, the incumbents in the corporate Portfolio Management Office (PfMO) and the PMO work together to develop policies and procedures and ensure that project methodology is consistent throughout the TTC and in line with the corporate direction set by the PfMO.

Performs and/or coordinates the planning, monitoring, analysis and evaluation of the applicable TTC Group’s project portfolio for efficiency and effectiveness, including coordinating the development, implementation and ongoing monitoring of project, program and portfolio schedules, cost and scope controls, performance measures and audit/quality assurance activities to ensure project management governance adherence.

Staples Canada is on a journey to become the Working and Learning Company. We are dynamic, inspiring partners to our customers and the communities in which we live. At Staples, we inspire people to work smarter, learn more and grow every day. We look for people who are curious, approachable and passionate, and who enjoy finding solutions.
If that’s you, let’s work, learn and grow together.
Some of what you will do

As the Merchandise Planning Analyst, you bring alive the promise of work, learn, & grow for our customers by supporting Retail Stores and the E-commerce business with the right amount of inventory, at the right time and at the right place. You will work closely with Category Specialists, Category Managers and other cross-functional team members to forecast, provide order recommendations, order fulfillment and overall inventory management duties. You will also regularly analyze current and historical trends to provide insights within categories and execute aspects of reverse logistics program. With a large scope of impact and partnerships with a variety of stakeholders, each day will be fast-paced, challenging, rewarding and meaningful.
Specifically, you will:
Perform daily inventory fulfillment tasks in your category including purchase order creation and determine allocation of available inventory to Stores and Fulfillment Centres.
Review inventory KPI’s on a frequent basis and evaluate inventory management opportunities and results, in partnership with the Category Manager.
Manage Store and Fulfillment Centre inventory balancing customer experience, sales while managing to the inventory KPI’s.
Complete the daily out of stock review, identifying trends and inventory depth opportunities that could result in out of stocks.
Maintain proper SKU/Vendor setup as it relates to replenishment parameters in AS400, JDA Advanced Store Replenishment and/or Advanced Warehouse Replenishment applications.
Follow up with vendors on outstanding purchase orders to ensure flow of merchandise/supply chain is in place. Communicate with vendors regarding inventory availability and forecasting.
Collect, analyze and report on sales/inventory data to support seasonality and trends, and uncover opportunities.
Analyze inventory and sales data (where required) to support proposed promotion position and evaluate impact on current and future inventory levels to determine the best way to support customers.
Leverage JDA tools (e.g. profiling and seasonality) to improve inventory turns, in-stock and service level by fulfillment node.
Identify unexpected inventory opportunities between sales and forecast. Research to determine root cause working closely with the Merchant team and provide recommendations.
Manage customer fulfillment KPI’s such as in-stock, late purchase order management, vendor fill rates, system lead days, etc.
Issue and follow up with fulfillment nodes regarding the return to vendor (RTV) program to ensure cost recovery and that inventory is removed from the system in a timely manner.
Execute department and SKU level plans to drive unique Store/FC merchandise inventory strategies.
Qualifications
Some of what you need
2-3 years prior experience in a Merchandising, Buying or Supply Chain role is preferred.
Experience with business intelligence/decision support software
Experience in JDA software
Post Secondary education with a focus on retail management, inventory or supply chain is an asset
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (specifically Excel, Outlook, Access, Word, PowerPoint, Power BI), SQL and VBA.
Big Data Analytics - ability to provide insights, and/or predict opportunities proactively by extracting information from the data lake.
Ability to communicate effectively across a variety of stakeholders.
Curious
Approachable
Passionate
Solutions finder
Some of what you will get
Associate discount
Health and Dental benefits
RRSP/DPSP
Performance bonuses
Learning & Development programs
And more...

Office & Remote work available

As a member of the ATCO family, Rümi (pronounced ""roomie"" like a helpful roommate) is the trusted friend you’ve known for years. We’re a fast, fun, feisty team, dedicated to bringing homeowner happiness to our customers. (We also like snacks, puppies and our colleagues.)

We’re seeking a Senior Business Analyst to work on their legacy billing system replacement project. The primary responsibility is to ensure system solutions and related processes support overall company objectives and ensure the integrity and quality of customer billing data. This involves vendor applications deployment, enhancements and integrations to / from Salesforce, troubleshooting problems, identifying opportunities for increased effectiveness or efficiency in billing processes. Ideal Qualities:
Strong interpersonal skills and ability to engage with internal and external customers
Strong communication skills—verbal, written, listening
Willingness to work with a cross-functional team while supporting conflicting priorities and deadlines

GIS Analyst,"Belledune, NB",Belledune Port Authority,,"The Belledune Port Authority (BPA) is currently seeking a GIS professional to be the Port’s sole GIS practitioner, as well as to organize non-spatial electronic records. The position will be split approximately in half between GIS and records management. The GIS work will consist of collecting, converting and maintaining GIS data with ArcGIS Pro in a local file geodatabase
column2: analyzing data and creating map products
column3: preparing web map, story maps and basic Web AppBuilder apps

column1: The successful candidate must be able to work without technical supervision and be adept at identifying external professional support to achieve the work mission. The position reports to the Port’s Director of Engineering but will work closely with the entire staff and management.

This position is ideal for a self-starting passionate GIS professional able to balance a mix of routine GIS maintenance and editing with the ability to create new opportunities for GIS to provide value to other port personnel. It is essential that this position not only meet identified business needs, but also proactively seek ways to leverage GIS to provide solutions for staff members who may not yet know how GIS can support their objectives and workflows.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
GIS Duties:
Disconnected field data capture – collect data in the field using method and hardware suited to adverse weather conditions and limited or no online connectivity
Data conversion from CAD – capture GIS-relevant features from Engineering drawings using ArcGIS Pro
Data editing, metadata management and maintenance – Keep not only the spatial data accurate and up to date, but keep the metadata about this data up to date
Utilize presentation-friendly mapping tools to create things such as:
o Map-rich PowerPoint slides
o ArcGIS Story Maps
o Cartographically pleasing PDFs
o ArcGIS Web Maps
Perform basic spatial analysis and geoprocessing as needed
column2: and,

column1: Obtain, understand and utilize data from government entities such as GEONB, Statistics Canada, Fisheries and Oceans Canada.
Records Management Duties:
Migrate document file server to a SharePoint Electronic Content Management System (ECMS)
Classify documents into logical groupings, populate metadata and enter into the ECMS, with potential linkages to GIS
QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIRED SKILLS
Skills:
Intermediate to Advanced Esri GIS Desktop skills, especially with ArcGIS Pro (ArcGIS Server expertise not required)
Competent with creating and managing file geodatabases
Well versed in ArcGIS Online for Organizations, including both the data creation and management of users and permissions
Conversion of field data to GIS (e.g. conversion of point files, CSVs and CAD content into attribute-rich GIS feature classes with robust metadata)
Familiarity with raw survey data and how to efficiently enter into a GIS
Competence with field data loggers, GPS devices and mobile GIS tools
Expertise with Collector for ArcGIS (including preparation for offline usage)
Familiarity with ModelBuilder, Python and ArcPy for scripting light data and workflow automations
IT skills sufficient to allow for self-support and troubleshooting of technical issues
Bilingualism considered an asset, but must be fluent in English
Strong written and verbal communication skills.

5-7 years paid professional Esri GIS experience, with at least 2 years at the intermediate GIS Analyst level
Proven track record of successful GIS data conversion, capture and documentation
Ability to share and demonstrate examples of recent GIS map product creations, such as online Story Maps, interactive web maps and map-rich presentation content

Successful history of implementing GIS into business processes via integration of data, modelling, and software
column2: and,

column1: Successful history of creating employee engagement through thoughtful training and support.
Education:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Geography or Bachelor’s degree in another field with a GIS Certificate
column2: and,

column1: Exposure to environmental data such as telemetry for air monitoring sensors or other live sensor feeds.
Disposition and Attitude:
Energetic, independent, a quick learner, and a self-starter
Highly motivated to find opportunities to innovate and invent solutions to share with others
column2: and,

column1: Eager and able to leverage online resources, search engines, and articles to find solutions to problems.
WORKING CONDITIONS

This position entails primarily working indoors in an office environment using GIS/IT related computing equipment. However, at times it may also require a substantial amount of outdoor activities on port property to collect GIS data and attributes, verify data in the field, etc. This may at times include working in inclement weather and will require reasonable mobility and endurance to support carrying and utilizing GPS data loggers and other mobile devices while walking outdoors. This will be a moderately independent role, so it may occasionally be necessary to move/adjust/lift typical office computing equipment, load paper in plotters and printers, bend or reach to connect/disconnect cables to devices, etc.

E8G 2W2

The Port of Belledune is a world-class deep-water facility with four marine terminals, offering exceptional year-round cargo handling capacity. Comprising of ultra-modern facilities and equipment and situated in a strategic location for accessing large North American markets, the Port has continued to grow and evolve over its 50+ year history.

Generating great economic spinoffs in the region, the Port continues to hold a strong role in supporting the local job market and continues to reinvest profits back into the community in the form of donations and sponsorships. We are the WSIB. And we're here to help.
What can I expect to do in this role?
This posting is for 2 temporary opportunities - 7 months & 15 months.

WSIB offices remain closed due to COVID-19. Our priority is the health and wellness of employees and the people of Ontario. As such, this position may involve working from home for all or part of the duration of this position.
Job Summary:

The Human Capital Analyst provides data analysis and reporting on a wide range of HR data, programs and initiatives for WSIB management and HR leaders to support them in making operational and strategic HR decisions. In addition to producing various standard and customized reports on a regular and ad hoc basis, this role will also lead the end-to-end BI dashboard development, statistical modeling and data process change efforts by applying a consultative and agile approach in supporting HR initiatives and programs.
Key Accountabilities and Responsibilities:
1. Conduct in-depth analysis of HR data to identify relationships, trends and issues for management information, decision making or action
Build queries to extract, compile and analyze data using PeopleSoft, PowerBI, Excel, Access and/or SAS
Develop hypotheses to determine appropriate data to include in analyses
Perform statistical analysis and develop “what if” scenarios to analyze data to identify trends, create predictive forecasts, and measure results
Draw data linkages and develop quantitative and statistical models by conducting descriptive and predictive analysis.
Develop costing models based on current data, identifying key variables and assumptions

2. Prepare standard and ad hoc HR reports for various purposes including statutory compliance, collective bargaining/labor relations, WSIB executive, Joint Occupational Health & Safety Committees, HR program implementation, resource planning and operational management
Prepare daily, weekly, bi-weekly, quarterly and annual reports according to the HR Reporting Schedule

Assess ad hoc requests and consult with requestors to determine context, data requirements, work effort and time required to ensure quality reporting that addresses the requestor's business need. Identify any potentially contentious issues and escalate as required.
Determine the most appropriate method for conveying information, for example, reports, dashboards, scorecards, presentations
Present relevant trends, identify issues and implications to the business leader and provide consulting, guidance and advice on interpreting and acting on data
Recommend relevant HR metrics based on best practices to enable external comparison and internal benchmarking over time
3. Participate in cross-functional projects and initiatives within HR and across other divisions as the Human Capital Analytics representative. Specific projects and initiatives may change over time
Provide subject matter expertise and guidance on HR data, metrics, standards and best practices
Provide data and reports as requested during initial scoping, design, development, implementation and evaluation of the project/initiative
Keep other stakeholders apprised of status and data reporting
Lead the implementation of any ongoing reporting according to the agreed upon process and schedule
4. Conduct research and participate in benchmarks surveys and studies to provide identify external comparators and perspective
Co-ordinate, lead or participate in benchmark surveys from external parties such as Conference Board of Canada and Corporate Leadership Council

Identify appropriate comparators to benchmark WSIB metrics from a variety of sources including other organizations, AWCBC members, Statistics Canada, Conference Board of Canada, Bersin, Corporate Leadership Council and others
Research specific HR topics of interest for the purposes of identifying best practices and workforce trends by gathering, analyzing, summarizing and communicating
5. Develop and maintain data and reporting standards
Assist in the development of data and reporting standards to ensure data integrity, consistency and reliability of data reported
Investigate possible methods of improving and/or automating the reporting process through query scheduling, use of Access and other tools
Ensure that all reports produced adhere to data standards and intake process governance
How do I qualify?
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Job Requirements:
1. Education (Level and Specialty / Discipline):
Bachelor's degree in business analytics, finance, statistics, information system, social science or related field
2. Experience (Years of Related Experience and Type of Experience):
3-5 years of experience in data analysis and reporting or similar role in HR function.
High proficiency and expertise in business intelligence tool PowerBI (from design, development to deployment) as well as MS office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access)
Solid experience with HRIS and ATS system, including but not limited to PeopleSoft, SuccessFactor, Avature, Oracle, and Workday etc.
Working knowledge of SQL and other programming language such as R, SAS or Python.
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to influence decisions
column2: quick learner with ability to pick up new technologies/skills and business knowledge

column1: Solid project management and consulting experience.

In & Out of Service
Company Profile

Maximus Canada is an industry leader in the provisioning of products and services to support the delivery of government services in North America and internationally. With operations across Canada and around the globe, Maximus provides innovative, practical and meaningful solutions to help government programs and services function more effectively and efficiently.

We are constantly assessing new technology, processes and methods of delivering services to the citizens of Canada. With our expertise in program information management, claims processing, contact centre services, document processing and information technology, we are positioned for significant growth.

Maximus Canada offers competitive market-based salaries, comprehensive employer-paid benefits and a defined-benefit pension plan or a Group RSP with employer-matching contributions, for eligible employees. Our people also get some great perks too, such as employee appreciation events throughout the year, along with a supportive results-oriented work environment.

Join us here in beautiful Victoria, British Columbia to experience the best of the West Coast lifestyle. You will work in an environment that will challenge you and reward your achievements. Your downtime can be spent exploring all the West Coast has to offer – scenic beauty, culinary experiences, cultural events and outdoor activities. We have it all! Located in the heart of downtown, our location offers easy access to every amenity.
Maximus Canada welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.
Core Values

At Maximus Canada, we believe that our culture strengthens our commitment to Helping Government Serve the People. We foster a culture that respects and values individual contributions and differences. At Maximus Canada we believe in the following four core values:
Customer Focus

Our customers' business needs inform everything we do. We start by developing relationships built on trust and respect. We listen, and incorporate their diverse experience into our services and solutions, and we show our understanding with clear communication.
Disciplined Approach

With decades of experience delivering government programs, we balance tried and tested processes with a desire for continuous improvement. We take the time to plan and benchmark our performance – it's the path to success.
Results and Delivery
Great results depend on setting high, measurable standards of excellence and achieving the numbers. We challenge each other and hold one another accountable to our commitments.
A Great Place to Work

Maximus Canada promotes a challenging work environment, empowering our employees to get the job done. If you want to work in an environment that recognizes and rewards accomplishments while caring about each other and the communities we serve, this could be the place for you.
Department Overview

The Pharmaceutical Services Segment is a part of the MAXIMUS Canada IT department. The Pharmaceutical Services team is responsible for information management and information technology processes and supporting technical applications in the PharmaCare domain on behalf of our client, the B.C. Ministry of Health.

The team provides full cycle of the application management services in the PharmaCare business domain including development of new solutions and integration of COTS products, as well as Production Support and maintenance functions such as system enhancements and bug fixes.

A key component of the PharmaCare domain is PharmaNet, the provincial Drug Information and Pharmacy Claims and Payments system. PharmaNet is a 24x7 system which provides access to a centralized repository of patient medication profiles to authorized health care practitioners. All community pharmacies in B.C. connect to PharmaNet, as well as a large number of community practitioner offices, hospitals and emergency departments.

The Pharmaceutical Services team Business Systems Analysts and Testers work with their counterparts in the Development, Infrastructure, PMO and Operations business units to ensure PharmaNet runs smoothly and without interruption, and meets all of its Service Level Requirements.
Role Summary

The role of the Business Systems Analyst (BSA) Lead is to work with the project team and stakeholders to define and capture project scope, map out the current and future state business processes, elicit and effectively capture requirements and design, and support the developers through to project delivery. The BSA Lead will be able to lead teams of business analysts or cross functional teams in planning, requirements and design activities, and be capable of managing smaller projects. The BSA Lead supports the product owner by helping them analyze the business domain, stocking and grooming the product backlog and may fulfill the role of scrum master or co-product owner on Agile projects. The BSA lead is able to translate technical documents to non-technical stakeholders and has some proficiency in basic SQL and XML scripting. Depending on the project, the BSA Lead may also be asked to perform hands on quality assurance using both manual testing methods and automated testing tools.

Bilingual Consultant, Data Analyst,Canada,Workforce Edge,,"Faites une différence !

Workforce Edge aide les organisations du secteur de la santé à mettre en place des pratiques exemplaires de planification des horaires du personnel et de transformer les pratiques de gestion de la main-d’œuvre. Plus de 70 % des budgets de santé sont consacrés à la dotation en personnel, et les organisations dépendent de la présence d’une main-d’œuvre engagée et qualifiée pour fournir des soins de qualité à tous les Canadiens. Nos projets améliorent la vie professionnelle des employés, offre une plus grande mobilisation des employés, un meilleur contrôle sur les coûts de main d’œuvre, et la capacité de prodiguer des meilleurs soins aux usagers et leurs familles.

Nous sommes présentement à la recherche d’un conseiller/analyste bilingue (français/anglais), qui possède une expérience dans la planification des horaires de modèles 24h/24, 7j/7 ou engagé dans les secteurs RH/RT de la planification des horaires du personnel. Il peut s’agir de postes antérieurs en tant que planificateur, coordonnateur, ou commis en planification des horaires
column2: analyste de la main-d’œuvre
column3: ou des postes similaires au sein des ressources humaines ou de la planification de la main-d’œuvre dans des secteurs tels que les soins de santé, les compagnies aériennes, le secteur manufacturier ou les technologies de l’information.

column1: En tant que Conseiller Workforce Edge:

Nous avons toujours été une équipe qui travaille à domicile, et la plupart des jours seront consacrés en télétravail au sein d’une équipe répartie à travers le Canada et travaillant à distance avec nos clients (par téléphone, courriel et réunions en ligne). Dans ce rôle vous devrez analyser les données relatives aux salaires et aux horaires des clients et préparer des tableaux et des graphiques, à contribuer à l’examen des horaires et des pratiques de planification des horaires, à concevoir et à assurer la qualité des horaires, soutien l’amélioration des processus d’affaires et à préparer des projets de rapports et de présentations. Vous contribuerez également à l’amélioration continue de nos outils et méthodologies.

Workforce Edge helps our healthcare clients implement effective staff scheduling practices. Over 70% of healthcare budgets are spent on staffing, and organizations depend on having an engaged and skilled workforce to deliver quality patient care for all Canadians. Our projects improve the working life for employees and reduce the cost of delivering care.

We are looking for a Consultant & Data Analyst who is bilingual (English/French) and has past experience scheduling for a 24/7 workforce or involved in the HR/LR aspects of staff scheduling. This could include past positions as a scheduler, scheduling clerk, scheduling analyst, workforce analyst, or similar positions in HR or workforce planning in industries such as health care, airlines, manufacturing, or IT.
As a Workforce Edge Consultant:

We have always been a remote team, and most days will be spent working at your home office, connecting with consultants across Canada and with client contacts by phone, email, and online meetings. Your normal activities will be to analyze client payroll and schedule data and prepare tables and charts, contribute to reviews of schedules and scheduling practices, design and QA schedules, support business process improvements, and prepare draft reports and presentations. You will also contribute to continuous improvements of our tools and methodologies.

Attendance at internal and client meetings by telephone/online meeting will be required daily to clarify data, present and review draft deliverables, record client input, and support senior consultants by documenting discussion items and action items. Occasionally, you will travel to client sites, working with senior consultants to record the results of interviews and focus groups, support process design, training and implementation activities, and participate in other on-site meetings and activities. On average, business travel is 3-4 days duration and most consultants complete between 6-12 trips per year (although during the COVID pandemic, we are not requiring travel to client sites).

Cubic Global Defense
Company Details:

This position applies comprehensive technical and tactical knowledge in order to create AARs to meet the training objectives. When not conducting the essential duties functions, the OA may be called upon to assist in the tasks required to execute the training, or to assist in updating / fixing faults in the UOTS or CWES systems. An OA conducts training analysis in support of military training exercises. They work to make the best use of the UOTS and CWES systems, combined with military judgement, to ensure that data is captured effectively and in accordance with the plan for the construction and delivery of After-Action Reviews (AARs). All required training will be provided in order to accomplish the assigned tasks.
Job Details:
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Works in an Exercise Control Centre (EXCON), monitoring the events of an instrumented training exercise.
Works extended shifts (up to 13 hours) as required.

Operates an EXCON specific IT system which includes monitoring of instrumented training activity, monitoring tactical radio communications and communicating with Observer Controller Trainers (OCTs) in the field.
Analyzes data to provide objective evidence of training performance in line with the overall exercise plan.
Collates information from multiple systems into a useable format that OCTs can use for AARs at the end of each mission / phase. Assists with AAR delivery, centrally or in the field, as required.
Supports the training staff as required in exercise planning and preparation in trend analysis using the same tools.
Interfaces with training staff to meet their requirements within their schedule.
Conducts training of personnel on the use of the UOTS and CWES as required.
Assists the Technical System Integrator (TSI 2), within scope, in the maintenance / updating of the UOTS and CWES systems as required.
Conducts other duties as required.
Shift work and overtime beyond 40 hours per week required during exercise periods.
Require a 3-month probationary period
MINIMUM JOB REQUIREMENTS:

College diploma or higher however a combination of alternative education and experience will be considered. Working knowledge of military operations, training and tactics. Very familiar and comfortable with using computers, IT and MS Office applications. Possess good communication skills and able to deal tactfully and courteously with all personnel. Valid driver’s license. Proof of the legal right to work in Canada and secret security clearance from the Canadian Government. Requires mental alertness and ability to follow written and verbal instructions. Physically fit, able to lift 50 lbs repeatedly and able to work in tight spaces. Able to sit or stand for extended periods of time and to climb stairs. May be required to travel periodically, both nationally and internationally. Prefer 12 years military experience in the combat arms with former rank Sgt – Capt, Experienced in operations, training, and doctrine. Instructional experience and exercise planning. Bilingual in English/ French.

COMPANY OVERVIEW

POSITION SUMMARY

Baxter - Alliston is a cGMP manufacturing facility looking for a dynamic and motivated technology professional to join our expanding Information Technology department as a Senior Business Support Analyst. This role is responsible for gathering, documenting and analyzing business needs to develop software and business information solutions to resolve business challenges. This role will also have responsibility for ongoing support and development of critical business systems, application interfaces and collaborate on reporting and online data visualization dashboards.
QUALIFICATIONS
The following identifies key requirements for this position:
Diploma/degree in computer science or equivalent job experience.
A minimum of 5 years’ experience in computer programming and/or business analysis, as well as an understanding of standard software development concepts and practices.
Must have experience working on larger scale projects as well as handling day-to-day operational, technical and validation requests from the business.
Ability to successfully manage multiple tasks at any given point, strong relationship building skills.
Experience in a cGMP manufacturing environment (medical manufacturing preferred).
The incumbent must also be able to demonstrate strong technical ability, problem-solving skills, as well as excellent organizational, interpersonal, communication and multitasking skills.
Motivation, commitment and teamwork are key requirements to succeed in this fast moving, but, rewarding position.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Business Strategy
Work with the Technology team and business stakeholders to develop process improvements or re-engineering and recommending elimination of non-value work.
Integrate new systems and processes with existing applications and partner with internal and external customers to ensure systems meet the long-term business strategies.
Develop system requirement documents, design solutions and implement software. Develop strategies to integrate applications with local and corporate based systems.
Identify, create and facilitate technology changes by conducting business and systems process analysis and design with a focus on quality improvement and data management.
Identify risks and provide mitigation strategies using existing and new technology innovations. Communicate and escalate observations as required.
Champion the delivery of facility production and financial information by supporting business reporting or creating new data delivery options through dashboards, metrics and online functions.
Improve customer service and build partnerships with key stakeholders and business departments.
Operational
Perform administrative duties for local software access, lab systems and other corporate application services.
Provide first and second level support for local application systems, interfaces and vendor database software.
Work with corporate teams to support and resolve issues related to global applications and infrastructures.
Provide first level technical/functional support to internal users of JD Edwards and Siemen’s XFP as required.
Develop and maintain facility intranet as well as content and online dashboards and data displays.
Perform end-user support related to personal computing devices, networking and software installations.
Maintain datacenter infrastructure and configuration requirements and support the Information Services team for maintenance, backups and BCP.
Address customer requests and issues using a local incident tracking system.
Develop custom reports for major applications using SQL Reporting Services, Crystal Reports or Data Access Studio (DAS).
Other duties as assigned.
Project Management

Lead, create and maintain project schedules by developing project plans, specifications, managing scope, estimating time and resources, determining daily priorities, monitoring milestone completion, tracking all phases of the project lifecycle ensuring on-time delivery.
Manage customer relationships and expectations by developing a communication process to keep others up-to-date on project results.
Validate changes to ensure functional compliance and minimal disruptions when new or upgraded applications are released.
Support product quality through system upgrades, ongoing system validation activities and the selection of new and appropriate technologies.
Provide project level analysis – producing required project analysis documentation (business requirements, scope matrix, use cases, sequence diagrams, future state proposals, UAT plan).
Collaborate closely with developers to implement the requirements, provide necessary guidance to testers during QA process.
The following identifies other key knowledge and level of expertise for this position.
JD Edwards Enterprise One - (4 years required).
MES (Siemen’s XFP) - (Preferred).
Database design (SQL Server) and SQL Reporting Services - (Definite asset)
Business Analysis – (5 years required)
Project Management (3 years)
Experience in a cGMP manufacturing facility (Healthcare or Food Industry)
Web Technologies such as XML, ASP, HTML, C#, C++, and VB programming - (Definite asset).
Scripting languages such as Java, JScript and VB script - (Definite asset).
Understanding networking and computer virtualization (Definite Asset).
PHYSICAL/SENSORY DEMANDS
Over 80% of the day is spent sitting at the desk.
Lifting no more than 10 or 15 lbs from a bench position may be required (equipment is available to avoid strains).
Limited exposure to noise and dust, except when entering shop floor then noise level is high.
Limited exposure to hot and humid conditions in the summer months.
Sensory concentration is required for programming, analysis and planning.
Precision-work is required to ensure programming is accurate and in accordance with instructions provided.
Some on-call and weekend work may be required to support project, production and IT related projects.

Project Manager and Analyst, Business Integration and Techno...,"Toronto, ON",Law Society of Upper Canada,,"OVERVIEW:
JOB SUMMARY:

The Project Manager and Analyst is responsible to the Team Manager, Business Integration and Technology for managing the execution of complex and diverse projects and initiatives, including managing and/or documenting requirements, related to the gathering, analysis, research, testing and final delivery of a variety of solutions in a timely and effective manner, while applying a high degree of professionalism in establishing and maintaining project time lines, and managing multi-level stakeholders and their expectations affecting the Licensing and Accreditation department. The Project Manager and Analyst is responsible for the ongoing business and technical support, and management of the Licensing and Accreditation department’s technologies, including its candidate management system, examination administration systems, scanning technologies and their integrations with other LSO systems and processes. The Project Manager and Analyst responsibilities extend to the production of high stakes statistics for the Licensing and Accreditation department to support initiatives at both the Director and Executive level, and for Committees and Benchers.
QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

University (preferred) or college diploma or degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems or equivalent related discipline, coupled with relevant, ongoing education and experience in one or more of project management, business analysis, business processes, IT service management, and information systems solution architecture and design. A PMP designation would be an asset.
Minimum of 7 years progressive and related project management and business analysis experience. Must have significant technology project experience.
Breadth of knowledge and experience in project management (planning, implementation, measurement) under conditions of rapid change, competing priorities and supporting a diverse user community

Strong interpersonal skills to establish strong working relationships with external stakeholders and multi-level contacts across all departments, to present complex information, advise and collaborate on issues and develop and propose complex solutions.
Breadth and depth of knowledge / experience in Microsoft Office, MS Outlook and MS SharePoint platforms, and leveraging these technologies to meet business unit needs.
Technical knowledge of HTML, SQL, Java or database architecture/design would be an asset.

Strong verbal and written communication skills to facilitate meetings, provide instruction to staff or resources, communicate with stakeholders, administer project and process documentation and negotiate deliverables and/or contracts.
Strong understanding of business unit processes, workflows and management control structures
Strong understanding of performance measures, cost/benefit analysis and ROI
Speaks in a clear, articulate manner, using audience-appropriate language and terminology, for individual and/or group situations
Strong analysis and problem solving skills to provide complex analysis of information or data and to resolve escalated issues and support lower issue resolution.
Ability to determine solutions and provide complex analysis within broad guidelines through collaboration and investigation using internal or external resources or sources.
Strong leadership skills to effectively lead projects and project resources.
Ability to work independently.
Knowledge of the business workings of the Law Society’s systems and business culture would also be an asset.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Client / Customer Service Delivery

Works with Licensing and Accreditation staff, Professional Development and Competence staff, Information Technology staff, third party providers and other LSO stakeholders where applicable, to manage and/or facilitate the identification of business and end-user requirements for applications and technology solutions.
Liaises between Information Technology and internal/external LSO stakeholders, and resolves escalated technical and business systems issues.
Manages and/or performs business process and systems analysis, maintenance of system applications, supporting processes and technical and process documentation.

Evaluates system and process performance and effectiveness, and provides ongoing support for solutions while also providing regular reports to stakeholders and Licensing and Accreditation management regarding the status of projects and initiatives.
Assesses needs and makes recommendations for business process and system improvements and solutions.

Works closely with the Business Analyst and Java Developer in Information Technology to manage translation of business system design and requirements into functional specifications suitable for development of computer systems.
Establishes and manages working relationships with staff and/or contractors assigned to Licensing and Accreditation projects.
Assists business units in the creation of test scripts for applications being developed and implemented.

Works with Information Technology, Licensing and Accreditation staff, Managers and other LSO departments and stakeholders to gain agreement on cost effective and efficient system and process solutions.

Works closely with Management and Information Technology to produce complex queries and statistical analysis, while also managing the development of the data warehouse to support ongoing production of statistics.
Research

Researches, quantifies and develops business cases for cost-effective applications and process solutions to improve efficiency and quality of business systems in keeping with the defined and agreed needs of the department and industry best practices.

Maintains knowledge base with the current industry trends via professional networks, technical journals, online resources and training, and determines feasibility of Business System’s projects relating to planning, resource allocation, and timing.

Ensures awareness at all times of organizational objectives with respect to current and projected goals and plans to ensure that they are considered and in line with Licensing and Accreditation initiatives.
Special Projects and Initiatives
Manages business/project requirement review and facilitates sign-off with stakeholders.
Builds relationships with client department staff and managers, based on personal expertise and best practices with respect to technology solutions and business processes.

Consults with business units regarding process and performance issues, gains consensus with respect to recommending solutions, and manages project planning, development and implementation of those solutions.
Acts as liaison to external vendors and IT on behalf of the business.
Provides regular reports to Team Manager, Business Integration and Technology regarding the status of projects and initiatives, and escalates high impact issues for resolution.
Acts as a lead resource on large scale in-house or external vendor projects and performs project management and analyst duties as required on those projects.
Contributes regularly to strategic and business planning and long term departmental technology and process goals.
Team Membership

Works closely with members of the Licensing and Accreditation team, Information Technology team and other client departments in the identification, diagnosis, isolation and resolution of complex problems.
Develops and shares expertise regarding Law Society application systems, and regularly communicates with team members regarding systems issues, projects and initiatives.
Provides clarification to team members on technical issues and system function.

Is a key contributor to client department teams, managing projects and stakeholder expectations, chairing meetings, facilitating needs identification, and promoting the effective use of information technology solutions to business process and performance objectives.
The Project Manager and Analyst will consistently provide work direction to team members and contract resources assigned to specific projects and initiatives.
The Project Manager and Analyst may be involved in the recruitment, interview and selection process for vendors, contractors or new employees.
COMPETENCIES:
Service Orientation
The requirement to maintain a high standard of commitment, ethics, respect, care in service delivery to clients (internal and/or external).
Communication and Interpersonal Skills
The requirement to structure and deliver effective verbal and written communication with clients, staff, licensees, the public, and others in a non-threatening and constructive way.
Team Orientation
The requirement to share responsibility for the achievement of team goals and the associated behaviours required for individuals to contribute effectively in a team environment.
Continuous Improvement
The requirement to demonstrate an attitude that consistently strives to improve a standard of excellence for one’s self and for the benefit of the organization, its licensees and stakeholders.
Problem Solving and Judgment

Provide guidance to senior staff to determine requirements for new health informatics initiatives, including performance measurement and reporting, and program development.

Document and analyze processes, gather requirements, perform best practice reviews, gather data to support, and perform current state assessments and gap analysis on initiatives on the established health systems.
Liaises with a broad spectrum of clinical, IT and business stakeholders.
About the Clinical & Systems Transformation (CST) Project

The Clinical & Systems Transformation (CST) Project is one of the largest health care projects in British Columbia's history. It is a joint undertaking between Vancouver Coastal Health, the Provincial Health Services Authority and Providence Health Care to complete a significant transformation of clinical practices and systems. This is an exciting initiative that will deliver key benefits for our patients, health care providers and health organizations.
WHO WE ARE

Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH) is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents living in Vancouver, Vancouver's North Shore, Richmond, the Sea-to-Sky Highway, Sunshine Coast, and the Central Coast (Bella Bella and Bella Coola.) At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and ""going first"" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. At our core, we are a people-focused organization where entrepreneurial spirit runs deep, and opportunity exists for all those who see themselves in the transformation of health care as we know it.

Spend your summer working with our industry experts to identify opportunities and create efficiencies that support our global business. You will make meaningful contributions while developing your professional expertise in a dynamic team environment.
What You Can Expect

This 10-week program — a talent pipeline for our full-time rotational Corporate Analyst Development Program — will provide you with the opportunity to work with colleagues across various lines of business to drive growth, innovation and strategy, ensure operational effectiveness, manage risk and maintain our global reputation for excellence. You will gain insight into various phases of key business projects and initiatives across the firm. You will also see how our businesses come together to serve our clients around the world.
During the internship, you will have the opportunity to develop your foundational skills within one of our lines of business or corporate functions, in one of three core business disciplines:

Analytics: Lead or participate in projects and tasks that involve data analysis methods driven by business need. Identify connections between business opportunities, challenges, and underlying data. Compile and present analysis back to stakeholders in a concise and effective manner.

Project Management: Participate in/drive various phases of a project life cycle. Engage with the right resources and build relationships to meet project goals. Track, analyze, report, and address project issues while identifying, documenting, and vetting potential solutions.

Process Improvement: Lead or participate in the development of a critical initiative, which may include improvements in process, organization, people and/or technology. By working in one of the above disciplines, you will gain a comprehensive view of the firm. You will build your knowledge, network, and experience in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. Upon successful completion of the 10 week internship, you may receive an offer of full-time employment.
About You
You are a leader with the vision and initiative to develop solutions that drive change.

Our summer internship program is a pipeline for future graduate opportunities. 30 October 2020 (2359 SGT)
Our Mission

Talent is the currency of our business. Our commitment to providing best-in-class industry solutions is enabled by you. In turn, we offer a framework for career growth through unmatched training, experiences, and access across our businesses in over 100 countries. Our collaborative culture is designed to support your success — wherever it takes you.
What’s next?

Help us learn about you by submitting a complete and thoughtful application, which includes your resume. Your application and resume is a way for us to initially get to know you, so it’s important to complete all relevant application questions so we have as much information about you as possible.
After you confirm your application, we will review it to determine whether you meet certain required qualifications.

If you are advanced to the next step of the process, you’ll receive an email invitation to complete a series of 12 games through the pymetrics platform. Pymetrics will allow you to showcase your potential beyond what you tell us in your resume and application form. It’s an additional data point that helps us gain a better understanding of who you are as an individual. It should take no longer than 25-35 minutes to complete. If you have already completed the pymetrics games, you will have the opportunity to submit your gameplay results for this specific application without having to replay the games.

Following completion of pymetrics, you’ll receive another email invitation to complete a video interview, powered by HireVue. This is your opportunity to further bring your resume to life and showcase your experience for our recruiting team and hiring managers.

Both pymetrics and HireVue are required, and your application will not be considered for further review until you have completed them. We strongly encourage that you apply and complete these required elements as soon as possible, since programs will close as positions are filled.

System Dynamics Analyst,"Geneva, QC",IISD,,"System Dynamics Analyst
Economic Law and Policy, Infrastructure workstream, Geneva, Switzerland
Position: Full-time equivalent, working on the Infrastructure workstream of the Economic Law and Policy Program
Remuneration will depend on experience.
Location: Geneva/Ottawa
About the International Institute for Sustainable Development

The International Institute for Sustainable Development (IISD) is an independent think tank that delivers the knowledge to act. Our mission is to promote human development and environmental sustainability. Our big-picture view allows us to address the root causes of some of the greatest challenges facing our planet today—ecological destruction, social exclusion, unfair laws and economic rules, a changing climate. With offices in Winnipeg, Geneva, Ottawa and Toronto, our work affects lives in nearly 100 countries.
Position Background

The analyst will support the IISD Infrastructure workstream, building and expanding on the use of system dynamics in calculating the risks and externalities of infrastructure projects. The use of system dynamics is core to our advisory services, of particular note is the Sustainable Asset Valuation (SAVi) tool. Visit iisd.org/savi/ for further details. The analyst will be part of a multidisciplinary team, working closely with IISD affiliates, consultants, and interlocutors in different parts of the word.
Responsibilities:

Simulation: The analyst is expected to use existing SAVi models (for power generation, buildings, roads, irrigation, wastewater management, natural infrastructure) and parametrize and calibrate them to new assets. The analyst will also be expected to support the creation of new sectoral and thematic models for new assets. Specific tasks include model creation with Vensim, data research and parametrization of the model, calibration and validation (structural and behavioural), and reporting (on the structure of the model documentation, validation, and results as well as interpretation of results).

Research: The analyst is expected to collaborate and conduct qualitative and quantitative research and simulation on the environmental, social, and economic performance of infrastructure projects and policies. The analyst will work across many sectors, including energy, material management, nature-based infrastructure and water. The selected candidate will be required to work independently and deliver analyses and writing that are “publication-ready” with limited oversight and editing. We also expect the analyst to develop communications and presentation materials, both collaboratively and independently. Experience in publishing papers in peer-reviewed journals is welcome, as is experience in preparing PowerPoint presentations for public events.

Collaboration and project management: The analyst will participate regularly in team meetings and strategy sessions to coordinate activities, contribute ideas, and execute new initiatives. The analyst will also collaborate with IISD staff, affiliates, partners, and consultants on the design and implementation of projects. We welcome applicants with entrepreneurial approaches to projects and an interest in business development.
Representation: The analyst will be required to represent IISD and present the results of his/her work to decision-makers and other relevant stakeholders around the world.

Communications: The analyst will develop and liaise on publications and communications materials with the Infrastructure team and the IISD Communications team. These materials will include op-eds, press releases, infographics, brochures, PowerPoint, etc. Experience with social media will be an advantage.
Other duties as assigned.
Required Skills
Simulation: advanced knowledge Vensim software is required
column2: knowledge of Stella and other software (e.g., GIS and InVEST) would be an advantage.

column1: Quantitative research methods: experience with mathematical models (e.g., differential equations, econometrics, optimization) and data analysis are required
column2: knowledge of various simulation techniques and models across sectors (e.g., energy optimization models, land-use models) would be an advantage.

column1: Qualitative research methods: knowledge and experience in creating causal loop diagrams (CLDs) are required
column2: experience in conducting surveys would be an advantage.

column1: Organizational and planning: ability to work autonomously, managing workload and producing deliverables to time and to budget
column2: results-focused, with an ability to prioritize and to work quickly and accurately
column3: flexibility to take on tasks ranging from highly complex to basic in nature.

column1: Required Qualifications
A minimum of a master’s degree in system dynamics, relevant interdisciplinary program or equivalent.
A minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience or an equivalent number of years in postgraduate research/teaching.
Available to travel internationally.
Excellent English-language skills, written and spoken (our working language is English). Professional competence in other languages is a distinct advantage.
Computer and Internet skills, primarily related to the use of MS Office and Vensim.
Swiss or EU nationality. (For Geneva location)
Canadian work permit. (For Ottawa)
Application deadline: We are open to applications until the right candidate is recruited.
Start date: October 1, 2020
Application Procedure
Applications will only be accepted through Bamboo HR
A CV (no longer than two pages)
A letter of motivation, one page.
A sample of writing in English, with you as the sole author, attach along with resume and cover letter.
Only candidates short-listed for an interview will be contacted. References will not be contacted unless the application is successful.
